Possess excellent typing speed and accuracy
Exceptional knowledge of correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation
Strong attention to detail
Maintain strict confidentiality while handling sensitive information
Demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to stay focused on assigned tasks
A high school diploma is mandatory. Additional computer training or certification will be considered an asset.

Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to over 30% of the Fortune 100 with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.

Last year, more than $3.3 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.

The Trust & Safety team seeks to deliver the trustworthy, safe, and inclusive work marketplace that sparks a global movement to reimagine work. We are looking for an intelligence analyst to help understand trends in serious fraud on our platform, and monitor and interpret the behavior of sophisticated fraud rings. You’ll partner closely with Trust & Safety Enforcement teams to understand intent and actors behind fraud activity on platform, and track evolution of modi operandi as our detection evolves.

Your Responsibilities:

You will work closely with teams across Trust & Safety to understand the evolving behavior of different fraud groups on the Upwork platform.
You will build sourcing processes from our operations teams to ensure the right information and cases reach you to develop insights.
You will conduct extensive off platform research to better understand how Upwork is being abused by fraud actors worldwide.
You will detail and prioritize clear, easy to understand requests for information on an as-needed basis for our Investigations and Analytics teams.
You will own and maintain our attribution guidelines for associating activity to a fraud ring, and evolve these guidelines as behavior shifts.
You will deliver regular, clear reporting on current trends in on-platform fraud conducted by organized/coordinated groups.


What it takes to catch our eye:

Experience in intelligence analysis, whether in the private sector, law enforcement, military, or intelligence community.
Experience conducting OSI (Open Source Intelligence) collection operations.
A self starter, able to stand up programs from the ground up, and build new processes from scratch
Comfortable both extrapolating intent from limited data and interpreting the results of large-scale analysis to understand trends.


The annual base salary for this position in California and Washington ranges from $71,000 - $129,000. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive program.

Come change how the world works.

At Upwork, you’ll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees.

Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. And oh yeah, we've also got amazing benefits - including medical insurance for you and your family, unlimited PTO, 401(k) with matching, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, and a generous Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about our benefits and the employee experience.

Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about the employee experience.

Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

To learn more about how Upwork processes and protects your personal information as part of the application process, please review our Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice

Description




Overview




A&F IT is a unit under the Executive Office for Administration & Finance (A&F) and is overseen by the A&F IT Secretariat Chief Information Officer (A&F SCIO). A&F IT is comprised of more than 200 employees working on IT systems and applications for 15 various A&F agencies. A&F IT oversees and provides all the IT application support for these agencies to ensure their IT operations are running effectively and efficiently. Information regarding these supported agencies is available at https://www.mass.gov/orgs/executive-office-for-administration-and-finance (see section on “Related Organizations”).




A&F IT is looking to hire a highly motivated college intern to join its Analytics team in the Enterprise Services Group as a software developer for work on its PowerBI and Tableau dashboards. This intern will work during the summer months, from May/June through August/September.




Responsibilities




The intern will assist the Analytics team to review and strategize analytics dashboards. The intern will obtain hands-on experience with the PowerBI or Tableau platforms to learn how to create visualizations to help assist in decision making and cause analysis.




The Intern Will




Learn PowerBI/Tableau platform using online training based on recommendations from Analytics team
Manipulate datasets using Excel and other ETL tools to assist with preparing viable datasets
Analyze the dashboards to identify patterns and areas of concern
Work with the Analytics team and business users to provide recommendations to mitigate the issues
Evaluate and build data for test and test dashboards for accuracy
Present a dashboard to senior management with recommendations




The intern will gain experience in working as an individual or as part of dynamic team to design and develop analytic visualization solutions that are based on real life scenarios and will assist management in decision making.




Preferred Qualifications Include




Enrolled as a full-time college student in upcoming school year
Highly energetic, enthusiastic and confident self-starter
Detail oriented and capable of independently tracking and following up on commitments
Excellent verbal, analytical and written communications skills
Ability to take responsibility and function under minimal supervision
Comfortable working with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio)
Knowledge and use of video conferencing software (such as MS Teams, Zoom, WebEx)




This position is assigned to A&F IT’s offices at MITC, 200 Arlington Street in Chelsea, Massachusetts. Currently, this position will require in-person and virtual presence, as assigned by the supervisor. The offices at MITC are MBTA accessible.




Hourly rates are $21.00 for undergraduate students and up to $30.00 for graduate students based on field of study, experience, and grade level.

Apply now Job no: 526028




Work type: Staff Full-Time




Location: Main Campus (Gainesville, FL)




Categories: Business/Accounting/Finance, Social/Behavioral Science




Department: 16980500 - LS-BEBR POPULATION




Classification Title




Data Management Analyst II




Job Description




The Bureau of Economic and Business Research (BEBR) at the University of Florida invites applications for a Data Management Analyst II position to work as a Demographer in BEBR’s Population Program. The successful applicant will join a team of research demographers and GIS specialists to develop state and local population and household estimates and projections for Florida. The position also involves collaboration with program staff on other demographic and GIS research projects, contracts, and grants.




BEBR houses one of the oldest and most active applied demography programs in the nation. The program has a long history of producing population estimates and projections for Florida, with annual data releases going back to the early 1970s. The successful applicant will join a team of research demographers and GIS specialists to develop state and local population and household estimates and projections for Florida. You will also collaborate with program staff on other demographic and GIS research projects, contracts, and grants.




The BEBR population estimation and projection models are run in SAS, R, and Excel. Advanced statistical software programming skills, including the writing of scripts and macros, are essential competencies for this position. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to collecting, manipulating, analyzing, and interpreting complex demographic and socioeconomic datasets. You should possess good data analytic and visualization skills, with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail. An ability to develop innovative statistical programming solutions to address data quality issues is desirable.




The position requires good communication skills. You will interact with federal, state, and local government officials, businesses, the media, and members of the public to provide information on demographic topics and serve as a Florida representative to the U.S. Census Bureau’s Federal-State Cooperative Programs for Population Estimates/Projections (FSCPE/FSCPP).




Expected Salary




The salary range is $57,500 - $77,500, commensurate with qualification sand experience.




Minimum Requirements




Master’s degree in demography, sociology, economics, geography, planning, statistics, or a related discipline. Bachelor’s degree in demography, sociology, economics, geography, planning, statistics, or a related discipline and two years of relevant experience.




Preferred Qualifications




Advanced statistical and spreadsheet software coding skills (SAS/R and Excel), including scripting, writing macros, and other automation features (required)
Experience producing population estimates and projections
Experience with demographic and socioeconomic data
Experience with data analytics and visualization techniques
Knowledge of geographic information systems (ArcGIS and/or ArcGIS Pro)
Knowledge of database software applications (Microsoft Access and/or SQL)
Ability to manage multiple deadlines independently
Good interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills




Special Instructions To Applicants




In order to be considered, you must upload your cover letter, resume, and the names and contact information of at least three professional references.




Application must be submitted by 11:55 p.m. (ET) of the posting end date.




Health Assessment Required: No




Advertised: 13 Mar 2023 Eastern Daylight Time




Applications close: 02 Apr 2023 Eastern Daylight Time

Need to have great attention to detail and excellent data entry skills.

Global Health Labs is seeking a Graduate-level Summer Intern join a dynamic applied machine learning group that develops intelligent healthcare solutions for low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).




Organization Overview




Global Health Labs (GH Labs) is a non-profit organization created and fully funded by Gates Ventures (the private office of Bill Gates) to advance the global health priorities of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Guided by our commitment to health equity, our team of 100+ multidisciplinary experts develops innovative tools and technologies that address unmet healthcare needs, especially in low- and middle-income countries.




Together, we pursue our mission across the three focus areas of:

Diagnostics (‘Dx’)
Maternal, Newborn & Child Health (‘MNCH’)
Primary Healthcare Center (‘PHC’) Hardware and Equipment




Recent technology solutions advanced by GH Labs resulted in several commercially available rapid COVID-19 antigen tests. Additional innovations include an AI-enabled tool to detect precancerous cervical cells with a smartphone and a vaccine cold chain container that better enables last mile delivery, among many other products that help improve healthcare outcomes around the world.




Role Summary




The Machine Learning Engineering Intern will lead the efforts in developing machine learning solutions and drive independent investigations to solve the key challenges being faced in the healthcare-machine learning community, in service of GH Labs’ mission. In addition, they will analyze and process large-scale medical image datasets while getting involved in the inherent complexities of building ML algorithms with medical data.

Additionally, as a member of the Engineering & Software team, the Machine Learning Engineering Intern will be deeply integrated within an interdisciplinary team of machine learning scientists, data scientists, clinical experts, software engineers, and research engineers working to improve healthcare outcomes in LMICs.




Key Duties and Responsibilities




The Machine Learning Engineering Intern will:

Understand, analyze, and process large medical datasets.
Research and apply cutting-edge solutions for machine learning-based algorithms.
Design and execute computer vision experiments in areas including object detection, image classification, visual transformers, domain adaptation, adversarial learning, unsupervised learning, active learning, and explainable AI.
Work with multi-disciplinary team to understand the medical dataset and related clinical terminology, and introduce new innovative solutions.
Design, implement, and test neural network models on the GPU enabled Linux clusters.
Develop tools related to explainable AI, error analysis, data exploration, data selection, data pipelining, and algorithm evaluation and comparison.
Present results to technical and non-technical stakeholders with appropriate analyses and visualizations




Required Skills & Experience




Currently enrolled in a Master’s or Doctorate program in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant discipline.
Organized and skilled at documenting work for the benefit of others.
Worked successfully in collaborative team environments to support overall team goals.
Demonstrated alignment or clear interest with global health mission.
Hands-on coding skills, preferably in Python or other data science languages.
Knowledge of ML workflow pipeline and basic deep learning operations.
Experience with at least one deep learning framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc).
Understanding of Linux environments, Docker, Git, and SQL.
Working experience with computer vision deep neural networks, including areas such as classification, object detection frameworks, generative modeling, adversarial learning, active learning, and unsupervised learning.
Solid software design and development skills and ability to write production quality code.
Comfortable “owning”, maintaining, and presenting ML workflows.
Ability to write detailed documentation.




Required Competencies




GH Labs Success Factors: We believe there are a few prioritized key capabilities and behaviors that are critical to success for all roles at GH Labs. They are:

Accelerates Impact: takes risks, proves/disproves concepts quickly and with a growth mindset, solves creatively, and partners strategically to achieve results and deliver impact on GH Labs mission.
Demonstrates Collaboration: actively listens and works with others openly and transparently to create an environment where diverse viewpoints are valued, and information is shared for the purposes of solving problems and achieving collective goals. Seeks collaborative solutions as the best path to sustainable change.
Promotes Accountability: holds self and others accountable so that success is celebrated, and failure is understood and addressed.
Establishes Trust: interacts, shares, and receives information and feedback in a way that builds trust and gains the confidence of others.




Role-Specific Success Factors

Action Oriented: takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
Cultivates Innovation: creates new and better ways for the organization to be successful.
Deals with Ambiguity: operates effectively, even where there is uncertainty. Secures and deploys information and resources effectively and efficiently in unpredictable environments.
Manages Complexity: makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.
Nimble Learner: actively learns through experimentation when tackling new challenges, using both successes and failures as learning fodder.




Equal Opportunity Statement:

GH Labs is committed to being an inclusive, equitable and positive workplace, where all employees thrive personally and professionally.




We believe our workforce should reflect the rich diversity of the global populations we work to serve.




We also believe in the research that demonstrates diverse groups – including groups diverse in experience and opinion – are more innovative than homogenous ones.




As such, diversity is a key pillar of our employment practices, and every applicant and employee drawn to serve the mission of GH Labs will be welcomed and will enjoy equality of opportunity and fair treatment without regard to race, gender identity, color, gender expression, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, pregnancy status, veteran status, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, prior protected activity, disability, and any other basis protected by law.




Eligibility:

Upon hire, new employees must present proof of: 1) eligibility to legally work in the U.S.; and 2) COVID-19 vaccination status. Currently, GH Labs requires a primary COVID-19 vaccination series and booster for all employees, unless there is an approved medical or religious accommodation. Questions regarding medical or religious accommodations should be directed to HR@ghlabs.org.




Export Controls:

This role may include access to technology and/or software source code that is subject to U.S. export control requirements under the ITAR or the EAR.




Pay:

GH Labs is committed to paying employees equitably for substantially similar work. A reasonable estimate of the current salary range for this position is $25.00 - $40.00 an hour.
Industries: Software Development, Research Services, and Biotechnology Research

Job_description:
Who we are:

BigID is an innovative tech startup that focuses on solutions for data security, compliance, privacy, and governance. We're leading the market in all things data: helping our customers reduce risk, drive business innovation, achieve compliance, build customer trust, make better decisions, and get more value from their data.

We are building a global team with a passion for innovation and next-gen technology. BigID has been recognized for being one of CNBC’s Top 25 Startups powering the economy, we're on Built In's 2023 Best Places to Work, #21 on the 2022 Deloitte 500 (most innovative, fastest-growing companies in North America) and we’re on the 2022 Inc 5000.

At BigID, our team is the foundation of our success. Join a people-centric culture that is fast-paced and rewarding: you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people in the industry who value innovation, diversity, integrity, and collaboration.

Who we seek:

A passionate, curious, and dynamic digital marketing coordinator to develop, execute, and measure success of highly targeted integrating marketing campaign plans.

You’re ambitious, have a love of organization and communication, love to iterate and test to see what will work even better than last time, proactive problem-solver, and want an opportunity to make an impact at BigID.

What you’ll do:

Coordinate and execute marketing activities including logistics, planning, scheduling, and more
Prioritize and proactively manage scheduling for all marketing projects in the request pipeline, coordinating the workflow of campaign deliverables, including go-to-market dates while keeping stakeholders informed
Work closely with internal stakeholders & vendors to execute and monitor the performance of marketing programs and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
Ensure projects are delivered with on-time deployment, including setting schedules and deadlines, coordinating resources, and monitoring and reporting project status
Establish and optimize processes, workflows, technology, and other operating requirements for the team
Own and optimize the demand generation team's workflows
Identify and execute against opportunities to improve the team's cross-functional workflows


What you’ll bring:

Technology savvy candidate with 2+ experience with expertise in a similar role in a high-growth tech start-up
A "no task too small" mentality, you’re comfortable getting into the detail and driving projects forward with a collaborative spirit and making things happen
A track record of rapidly scaling strategies and experiments that drive revenue in a fast-growing organization
Ability to accurately scope work, estimate effort and produce deliverables within established timelines.
Highly organized with proven ability to manage multiple work streams at one time in a fast-paced environment
Creative individual and enthusiastic self-starter focused on delivering results.
Demonstrated track record of managing multiple projects simultaneously, supporting ongoing operations, building appropriate processes and tools and delivering results
Creativity to develop innovative, custom programs and adapt with the market
Startup friendly: Agile, proactive, and execution-oriented
Strong Communication, relationship-building, time management, and project management skills


What’s in it for you?!

Our people are the foundation of our success, and we prioritize offering a wide range of benefits that make our team happier and healthier.

Equity participation - everyone shares in our success
Flexible work arrangements
Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k - that go into effect your first day


Our Values:

We look for people who embody our values - Care, Do, Try & Shine.

Care - We care about our customers and each other
Do - We do what it takes to make a positive impact
Try - We try our best and we don’t give up
Shine - We shine and make it our mission to always stand out


BigDiversity: We’re committed to creating a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality – across race, gender, sexuality, disability, and neurodiversity – where innovation and growth thrive, every voice is heard, and everybody belongs.

The annual base salary range is $60,000-75,000. Actual salaries will vary and are based on a candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. Salary is just one component of our Compensation Philosophy. Variable/Bonus Compensation & Equity Incentives align with individual and company performance.

CPRA Employee Privacy Notice: CA

Arcaea is building a new ingredient toolset for the beauty and personal care industry - one rooted in biotechnology with the aim of delivering radical performance and unparalleled sustainability that will also present new opportunities for storytelling. This role will be critical to shaping and driving Arcaea’s ethos around a “biology-first” future for the industry. Our mission is to create the most consequential personal care ingredients and brands of this century.




We are building an organization where technology and storytelling coexist in a symbiotic relationship. To accomplish our vision we will need to be really good at two things: consumer engagement and technical innovation - and they will need to work together in concert.




As our Computational Biologist will collaborate with Arcaea scientists and external groups, as well as internal cross-functional groups to play a critical role in driving forward Arcaea’s R&D efforts with a mix of computational biology, statistics, and software engineering. You’ll perform a variety of technical duties from helping our biologists and chemists develop assays to analyzing complex datasets to accelerate product development or generate new product leads. Familiarity with microbiome studies and genomic datasets as well as general biostatistics are important to this role. Understanding how to develop and maintain pipelines, automated workflows, and databases is a plus and will become part of your responsibilities.




Responsibilities




Work with Sr. Computational Biologist to provide technical expertise toward design and execution of various biotech programs and projects
Summarize and visualize complex data sets to inform experimental design and product development
Design and execute computationally driven experiments to generate new product development strategies
Summarize and display complex data into actionable metrics to inform experimental design/next steps
Create and troubleshoot (custom) software in order to enable high throughput analysis pipelines
Create pipelines for analyzing complex datasets to feed into databases
Develop or implement internal tools for biologists and chemists
Help build biological databases for machine learning projects
Run software and scripts while keeping excellent records
Analyze large metagenomic and microbiome related data sets
Improve models for molecular interactions and binding activity
Communicate technical information to internal teams and/or external parties in the form of oral and written correspondence, presentations, and reports
Work with cross-functional teams to implement new technologies into new product development pipelines
Stay current on scientific literature (new methods, data analysis tools, etc) and cutting edge technology
Ideate on and develop novel solutions that help Arcaea achieve its vision: Limitless Expression
See your work translate to real world applications rapidly as you create new opportunities for Arcaea
Do “whatever it takes” to get the job done and work effectively and efficiently including on a tight deadline without drama or ego. We are a dynamic startup whose priorities may need to shift.




QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS:




Masters degree +3 years of experience or PhD in bioinformatics, biotechnology, biochemistry, computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a biology related field
Experience/proven ability to program/script in Python, R, and Bash/Unix shell
Practices agile software development and loves to write elegant code (please provide a link to any publicly available code when applying)
Experience installing, maintaining, and operating open-source bioinformatics software
Proficient in public scientific databases (ie, PubMed) relevant to our work and genomic resource databases (RefSeq, UniProt, Ensembl, NCBI, etc).
Experience with a cloud service provider and related infrastructure/services – ideally AWS
Experience with DNA/RNA sequencing technologies and data
Experience analyzing microbiome data sets, WGS or 16S as well as qPCR based assays
Familiarity with major tools used for NGS analysis as well as databases
Familiarity with workflow tools and software development tools (Git, Docker, Nextflow/bash/snakemake/airflow, etc).
Ability to work independently as well as on cross functional teams in a fast-paced environment
Passionate about keeping up with technology and new developments
Effective communicator, can explain complex science in layman terms




EXPERIENCE IN THE FOLLOWING A PLUS:




Implementing or managing relational databases (SQL)
Molecular modeling tools like PyMol, Rosetta, etc.
NGS data from Illumina and MinIon sequencing machines, (de novo) genome and hybrid assembly, and genome annotation
Research on host-microbiome interactions
Knowledge of human skin biology and immunology
Systems biology and metabolic modeling




We are committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion in all its practices. It is the policy of Arcaea to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants.

Job_title: Administrative Data Entry Clerk Remote - Virtual Assistant
Job_description:
We are looking for a methodical Market Research Analyst to survey customer preferences and statistical data in order to support customers during their decision making process regarding product designs, prices and promotions. The successful market researcher will be able to analyze autonomously qualitative data, trends, strategies and competition aiming at increasing competitiveness. A Data Entry Operator to update and maintain information on our company databases and computer systems.

Data Entry Operator responsibilities include collecting and entering data in databases and maintaining accurate records of valuable company information. Our ideal candidate has essential data entry skills, like fast typing with an eye for detail and familiarity with spreadsheets and online forms. You will work with a data team and Data Manager. Previous experience as a Data Entry Clerk or similar position will be considered an advantage. Ultimately, a successful Data Entry Operator will be responsible for maintaining accurate, up-to-date and useable information in our systems.

The ideal candidate should have excellent keyboarding skills, be proficient in Microsoft Office, and have experience with data entry or data management. They should also be able to work independently and be able to follow specific instructions and guidelines.

Responsibilities

Collect data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidate information into actionable items, reports and presentations
Understand business objectives and design surveys to discover prospective customers’ preferences
Compile and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect it
Perform valid and reliable market research SWOT analysis
Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations
Use online market research and catalogue findings to databases
Provide competitive analysis on various companies' market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation
Evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the releases are accurate and the angle of the release is correct
Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices
Keep information confidential
Compile, verify accuracy and sort information according to priorities to prepare source data for computer entry
Insert customer and account data by inputting text based and numerical information from source documents within time limits
Respond to customer queries in a timely and accurate way, via phone, email or chat

Requirement

Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with a wide range of people
Experience with market research or survey administration preferred, but not required
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed
Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience with data entry or a related field preferred, but not required
If you are a reliable and efficient worker with a strong work ethic, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our team.
Possess excellent typing speed and accuracy
Exceptional knowledge of correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation
Strong attention to detail
Maintain strict confidentiality while handling sensitive information
Demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to stay focused on assigned tasks
A high school diploma is mandatory. Additional computer training or certification will be considered an asset.

Company: The Center for Health Information and Analysis
Job_description:
The Center for Health Information and Analysis (CHIA) is an independent Massachusetts state agency that serves as the Commonwealth’s primary hub for healthcare data, and a primary source of health care analytics that support policy development. We are responsible for stewarding sensitive and confidential data, and objectively reporting reliable and meaningful information about the quality, affordability, utilization, access, and outcomes of the Commonwealth’s health care system. Our vision is a transparent health care system where reliable information provides common ground for improvement and empowers people and organizations to make informed decisions.




CHIA’s Health Informatics and Reporting (HIR) unit is seeking an intern who is interested in supporting our work monitoring the costs of health care services and health insurance coverage in the Commonwealth. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Excel (previous SAS, R, or statistical software exposure a plus), a strong writer, creative, and eager to learn. Familiarity and interest in the Massachusetts health care system is also helpful. The intern may be asked to perform data quality checks, conduct background research, and contribute to written reports, supporting the work of the team's analysts.




Interns will be placed with the team that produces the following reports (among others):




A Focus on Provider Quality:
Annual Report on the Performance of the Massachusetts Health Care System:
Enrollment Trends:
Relative Price:
Massachusetts Primary Care Dashboard:




Duties include:




Conduct research related to various policy and health system topics in support of HIR reporting
Develop tables and graphics using Tableau from aggregate data, as provided by analysts
Analyze data to identify trends
Perform data quality checks on draft analyses
Contribute to internal briefings and/or external publications, as needed




Preferred qualifications:




Experience utilizing Excel for data clean up and analysis; Exposure or experience with Tableau, SAS, or R a plus
Proficiency in producing graphs, tables, reports and presentations using Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
General understanding of, or interest in health care policy, financing, and delivery systems in Massachusetts, and how CHIA monitors those systems. Prior coursework in economics, statistics, political science or public policy, public health or health sciences, or actuarial sciences is helpful; all majors are welcome to apply
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing
Experience working on multiple projects while successfully meeting deadlines
Experience working collaboratively, as well as independently, with multidisciplinary teams




At CHIA, we are committed to earning a reputation as a great place to work and build a career. So if you’re excited to be part of a diverse and innovative team responsible for identifying opportunities to improve health care in Massachusetts, come join us! To apply and for more information visit: https://www.chiamass.gov/join-our-team/




CHIA is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Women, people of color, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.




If you have Diversity, Affirmative Action or Equal Employment Opportunity questions or need a Reasonable Accommodation, please contact Diversity Officer / ADA Coordinator: Tonya Bourassa 617-701-8127.




Information submitted by applicants is collected through the JazzHR Platform, your submission of application materials constitutes your express consent for this information to be provided to JazzHR for processing. Please do not include any personally identifiable information with your application materials other than that specifically requested by CHIA. CHIA requests basic information such as name, address, telephone number, and email address. You may also self identify race/ethnicity, gender, disability and/or veteran status if you so choose. However, you should not provide more detailed personal information such as your date of birth or Social Security Number with your application materials.




In compliance with federal laws, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.




CHIA has adopted Executive Order #595: COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement for Executive Department Employees




As a condition of employment, successful candidates will be required to have received COVID-19 vaccination and/or boosters prior to the finalization of the hiring process. Details relating to complying with this requirement will be provided to finalists.




Finalists who can provide documentation that the vaccine is medically contraindicated or who object to vaccination due to a sincerely held religious belief may make a request for a reasonable accommodation.




Executive order can be found here: https://www.mass.gov/doc/august-19-2021-executive-department-employee-vaccination-order

Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.




Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.




Who We Are…




When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…




From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.




Bleacher Report, a Warner Bros. Discovery company, makes it as easy as possible to be a sports fan by defining the moments that matter. Empowering, personal and community driven, its vision for making sports bigger than the game has led to unmatched engagement on social media, where it consistently ranks as the No. 1 digital and social brand. Bleacher Report also provides an industry-leading fan experience on mobile devices through its unparalleled app experience. This year Bleacher Report was ranked as one of the ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ by Fast Company. Find Bleacher Report on the web at www.bleacherreport.com and on Instagram @BleacherReport. Bleacher Report is a division of Turner Sports.




Your New Role…




Bleacher Report is seeking a data scientist for our team. This role will leverage your statistical and machine learning skills to support our content strategy including model development and maintenance. You will be working with cross-functional partners to solve broader business problems with data-driven insights and algorithmic thinking. You will also be assisting with business partner communications and expectation setting.




Your Role Accountabilities…




Use Python and other languages/applications to automate data extraction/management, analyze trends and performance
Develop solutions to solve business problems using machine learning and statistical analysis; help integrate models with the broader B/R ecosystem
Create impact by helping to solve difficult data science problems using a variety of ML techniques with careful investigations into accuracy / performance
Develop techniques of archiving model learnings and diagnostics so that the team can monitor model evolution over time.




Qualifications & Experience…




Understanding of applied statistics and machine learning algorithms, including methodologies for regressions, classification, clustering, and causality
Data science experience querying databases (SQL) and leveraging a scripting language (Python) to analyze data within a cloud environment· Experience with standard data science orchestration and automation (Airflow, DBT, lambda) is a plus
A quick learner that can work independently in a matrixed environment, adaptable, and a strong self-teaching ethic
Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and agile environment that can pivot quickly to capture opportunities from the users and business's changing needs.
Outstanding organizational, interpersonal (ability to influence without hierarchy), and communication skills




How We Get Things Done…




This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.




The Legal Bits…




In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $83,090.00 - $154,310.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).




Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.




If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

You will also be assisting with business partner communications and expectation setting.Your Role Accountabilities…Use Python and other languages/applications to automate data extraction/management, analyze trends and performanceDevelop solutions to solve business problems using machine learning and statistical analysis; help integrate models with the broader B/R ecosystemCreate impact by helping to solve difficult data science problems using a variety of ML techniques with careful investigations into accuracy / performanceDevelop techniques of archiving model learnings and diagnostics so that the team can monitor model evolution over time.Qualifications & Experience…Understanding of applied statistics and machine learning algorithms, including methodologies for regressions, classification, clustering, and causalityData science experience querying databases (SQL) and leveraging a scripting language (Python) to analyze data within a cloud environment· Experience with standard data science orchestration and automation (Airflow, DBT, lambda) is a plusA quick learner that can work independently in a matrixed environment, adaptable, and a strong self-teaching ethicThrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and agile environment that can pivot quickly to capture opportunities from the users and business's changing needs.Outstanding organizational, interpersonal (ability to influence without hierarchy), and communication skillsHow We Get Things Done…This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.The Legal Bits…In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. $83,090.00 - $154,310.00 salary per year. Title: Data Analyst

Client Industry: Truck and Transportation Services

Location: San Antonio, TX

Contract Type: 6-month contract plus extensions or conversion to full time employee

Schedule: Monday-Friday 6:30am- 4pm (45- 50 hours per week)

Pay: $30-40/hr W2 paid weekly and DOE

PPE: Safety Glasses/Steel Toe Boots Required




In this position, you will be supporting San Antonio Assembly operations facility in validating and implementing improvements of the Manufacturing Execution System looking for continuous improvement of the integration to our clients operating system. In this position you will have the opportunity to interact with multiple cross functional teams internally and externally within client’s working with industry 4.0 technology.

Responsibilities

• Develops and executes test processes related to end-user data and databases; documents and tracks data-related issues, and facilitates resolution of such issues

• Provide leadership team with a clear picture, information, and status summary reports

• Responsible for providing detailed analysis of quality data, (i.e., defects, units status)

• Resolve data quality problems through appropriate process design strategies, as well as error detection and correction tests and procedures

• Participate in continuous improvement projects /activities

• Collaborates to prepare and review data required for the quality manager

• Utilize existing reports to collect data for all reporting needs

• Analyze and validate data in preparation of internal dashboards and external reporting warranty

• Configure the MES Quality Data entry and reporting system

• Maintain the Quality Data entry and reporting system

• Train the organization in the use of the MES Quality Data System

• Generate KPI tracking reports

• Conduct Warranty tracking and investigation

• Identify Corrective Action Report and follow up

• Demonstrate effective problem-solving methods

About Rippling




Rippling is the first way for businesses to manage all of their HR & IT—payroll, benefits, computers, apps, and more—in one unified workforce platform.




By connecting every business system to one source of truth for employee data, businesses can automate all of the manual work they normally need to do to make employee changes. Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can just click a button and set up a new employees’ payroll, health insurance, work computer, and third-party apps—like Slack, Zoom, and Office 365—all within 90 seconds.




Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $700M from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, and Bedrock—and was named one of America’s best startup employers by Forbes (#12 out of 500).




About The Role




We’re looking for a hands-on IT Intern to join the Rippling IT team in San Francisco. Being a hyper growth startup requires an innovative approach to IT. The Rippling product provides Rippling and all its customers with superpowers for IT admins. As an early member of Rippling's IT team, and our first Intern, you will get first-hand experience using Rippling to manage IT for a growing, global company of almost 2000 employees!




What You Will Do




Manage office IT infrastructure including network, printers, video conferencing systems, audio equipment, access control, and more
Troubleshoot and resolve a wide range of issues with computers and devices
Troubleshoot and resolve problems across a variety of cloud tools and platforms
Maintain our hardware inventory, both in the San Francisco office and in our Warehouse, and coordinate shipping logistics for onboarding/offboarding using Rippling’s IT Tools
Administer Rippling’s IT products and features and suggest enhancements to better support our employees
Liaise with Rippling IT product team to improve Rippling IT features that serve our customers




What You Will Need




Proven experience supporting and working with technology, including both Mac and Windows operating systems
Some experience with: Google Workspace, Atlassian Jira/Confluence, Slack, Zoom
Working knowledge of Meraki Networks and Zoom video conferencing systems
Strong ability to research and learn independently, finding creative solutions to complex problems
A passion for technology and automation - experience with scripting is a plus!
Bonus points for a prior internship and/or work experience in a fast-paced environment supporting an IT function




Additional Information




This role will receive a competitive salary. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here.




Tier 1: $30/hour




A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation–including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed above.

The Data Analytics Intern is primarily responsible for assisting other Data Analytics team members with data collection. They will also be working with others who are passionate about making a positive impact on the industry by, building data integration solutions to meet the requirements of the business. They will also aide in managing data analysis and data integration across various systems. 




This position is onsite and located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. At this time, we are only targeting local talent with reliable transportation and are unable to offer sponsorship for this role.




Essential Functions: 




Assist with data preparation
Support dashboard and visualization development in Microsoft Power BI
Analyzing business data and creating forecasts using statistical models
Interface with diverse project teams, providing analytics support to advance key initiatives
Assist key business partners in determining appropriate data processing needs to meet their business objectives
Document work procedures, processes, and methodologies
Create high quality data files and cross-tabulations for analysis and reporting
Be able to aggregate and rollup large amounts of data across multiple programs into manageable information
Communicate frequently and effectively with team members to ensure data requirements, project timelines, and established goals are met
Learn how IT works with the business to translate opportunities into technology solutions
Utilize analytics to evaluate and direct key business decisions to ensure HT's overall success




Qualifications (skills, Knowledge, Experience)




Pursuing Bachelor's degree in an IT, Business, Math, or related field from an accredited college/university.
Experience with Power BI and/or other data visualization tools
Highly proficient in MS Office suite including MS Access and MS Excel
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to interact with internal customers and interpret business needs
Strong mathematics background to perform qualitative and quantitative analyses
Familiar with advanced statistical analysis including regression analysis
Knowledge of plastic manufacturing a plus

Through partnership with production-related departments and cross functional teams, you will identify needs for automation, assess potential solution sets, then design and implement the appropriate technologies. Company

At Land O’Frost, our brands of lunchmeat and specialty sausage products are recognized as one of the nation’s best- selling and trusted brands. We have accomplished this through our incredible team of employees who are customer focused, motivated, achievers, developers, and purpose driven.




Responsibilities

Work with and alongside various departments to understand how technology can be used to improve operations and decision making.
Understand enterprise applications and their associated data sets to eliminate sets of redundant data.
Acquire knowledge of manufacturing processes and workflows.
Develop expertise in IFS; our enterprise resource planning system (ERP).
Work closely with various IT team members to understand network architecture, communications infrastructure, software deployment standards and security requirements.




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Information Technology in a process-driven environment.
Knowledge of software development tools.
Experience in using relational databases as sources of data for application software.
Excellent oral and written communications.
Deep understanding of PCs and network connectivity.
Flexible and adaptable regarding learning new software systems and development platforms.
Available to travel 15% to visit plants, corporate office, training or as needed.

About FareHarbor




At FareHarbor, our mission is to make experiences better for everyone. Founded in 2013 in Hawaii and acquired by Booking Holdings in 2018, FareHarbor creates powerful tools that enable our clients (think boat rentals, museums, food tours, events and more!) to operate and grow.




With over 20,000 clients across 90+ countries—we’re the largest in our industry and shaping the future of travel, together.




Our team is an ‘Ohana of 650+ people around the world. We’re passionate about pioneering an industry, embracing challenges with open arms, and delivering value to the experiences industry.




FareHarbor Core Values




Think Client First
We Are One ‘Ohana
Be Curious and Learn
Own It.
Act With Integrity
Embrace the Challenge




Why FareHarbor?




Founding FareHarbor required unwavering passion. Turning a start-up into the world’s leading and largest reservation software for tours, activities, and attractions required relentless dedication and vision. To date, we’ve helped over 20,000 global businesses operate successfully and are proud to have played a role in enabling business owners to live their dreams.




And since day one, we’ve known that our real success lies in our people—the Ohana.




With each new feature launched and new client onboarded, there is a team of incredible people behind the scenes who are full of dedication, passion, energy, and the will to succeed. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work—to believe in their abilities, to freely express their creativity, and to contribute with their own uniqueness by wearing their true colors. We take care of one another and always prioritize health and wellbeing. We give our people the space and trust to learn, to try, to succeed, to collaborate, to think outside of the box, to make mistakes, and even to fail. And then we come together to try again.




From the minute you join, you have a voice. You find your space. You make an impact. We celebrate our victories, shout our successes, and are always eager to tackle new challenges. And we can’t wait to see all that’s to come.




About The Role




The BI Team is looking to add a Business Intelligence Analyst to the team, with a focus on Reporting and dashboard automations.




What You’ll Do Here




Work with client-facing teams (AM/Support/OB) to understand reporting needs of our clients and provide sustainable, timely solutions
Have a client-focused approach and ensure that clients’ needs are being met
Proactively identify opportunities and recommend solutions to align with overall FH business strategy
Provide daily, weekly, and monthly reports to a variety of internal and external groups as well as perform ad hoc analysis as needed
Perform data analysis from multiple data sources and build reports for projects such as executive dashboards, customer journey analysis, lead performance analysis, and digital and social campaign analytics
Continually improve reporting to facilitate improved client interaction and identify reporting problems and develop plans for improvement
Contributes to the efforts of building and maintaining a comprehensive reporting and tracking strategy for optimal performance




Requirements




Strong data skills - must be comfortable analyzing large quantities of data to create summaries, develop models, and extract insights
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written - be able to present results and reporting solutions in meaningful terms and instill confidence in recommendations both to internal employees and external clients
Intermediate knowledge of database languages, SQL/PostgreSQL.
Attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy on work output; ensures that reporting and analysis is on time and error free
Able to work quickly and prioritize multiple projects
Experience using data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau)
Bachelor's Degree in statistics, computer science, business or related field with 1 - 2 years of analytical experience




Benefits
Medical, dental + vision coverage
23 days of PTO + 12 paid holidays
Global leave benefit
22 weeks paid parental leave
2 weeks paid grandparent leave
Extended care and bereavement leave

Job_title: Administrative Data Entry Clerk Remote - Virtual Assistant
Job_description:
We are looking for a methodical Market Research Analyst to survey customer preferences and statistical data in order to support customers during their decision making process regarding product designs, prices and promotions. The successful market researcher will be able to analyze autonomously qualitative data, trends, strategies and competition aiming at increasing competitiveness. A Data Entry Operator to update and maintain information on our company databases and computer systems.

Data Entry Operator responsibilities include collecting and entering data in databases and maintaining accurate records of valuable company information. Our ideal candidate has essential data entry skills, like fast typing with an eye for detail and familiarity with spreadsheets and online forms. You will work with a data team and Data Manager. Previous experience as a Data Entry Clerk or similar position will be considered an advantage. Ultimately, a successful Data Entry Operator will be responsible for maintaining accurate, up-to-date and useable information in our systems.

The ideal candidate should have excellent keyboarding skills, be proficient in Microsoft Office, and have experience with data entry or data management. They should also be able to work independently and be able to follow specific instructions and guidelines.

Responsibilities

Collect data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidate information into actionable items, reports and presentations
Understand business objectives and design surveys to discover prospective customers’ preferences
Compile and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect it
Perform valid and reliable market research SWOT analysis
Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations
Use online market research and catalogue findings to databases
Provide competitive analysis on various companies' market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation
Evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the releases are accurate and the angle of the release is correct
Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices
Keep information confidential
Compile, verify accuracy and sort information according to priorities to prepare source data for computer entry
Insert customer and account data by inputting text based and numerical information from source documents within time limits
Respond to customer queries in a timely and accurate way, via phone, email or chat

Requirement

Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with a wide range of people
Experience with market research or survey administration preferred, but not required
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed
Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience with data entry or a related field preferred, but not required
If you are a reliable and efficient worker with a strong work ethic, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our team.
Possess excellent typing speed and accuracy
Exceptional knowledge of correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation
Strong attention to detail
Maintain strict confidentiality while handling sensitive information
Demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to stay focused on assigned tasks
A high school diploma is mandatory. Additional computer training or certification will be considered an asset.

The Data Engineering Intern will be responsible for developing new machine learning and deep learning algorithms that will impact future Spectral MD products focusing on medical imaging device data. The candidate will assist in the design and evaluation of developed algorithms, summarize research findings, and develop models for medical imaging data analysis in the field of image classification and semantic segmentation.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Work with a cross-functional technical team composed of frontend developers, software engineers, data scientists, and product designers.
Design and evaluate developed algorithms, summary research findings in technical documents or papers.
Perform data cleaning for machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
Research and develop novel machine learning and deep learning models for medical imaging data analysis, especially in the field of image classification and semantic segmentation.
All other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Required education and experience:

Must have a Bachelor’s degree and currently or recently enrolled in a Master’s or PhD program in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
Coursework on AI/Deep learning, imaging or computer vision algorithms

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Good understanding in machine learning and deep learning algorithms
Excellent programming skills in Python, C#, C/C++, CUDA
Knowledge of common deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch, Tensorflow, or Keras.
Knowledge of basic computer vision tasks of image classification, semantic segmentation, and object detection.
Knowledge of transfer learning, domain adaption and data augmentation
Knowledge of processing multispectral image data
Implementation of machine learning and deep learning algorithm in latest research papers
Good publication record

Physical Requirements

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

Description




About us




LifeMD is an emerging leader in technology-driven healthcare. We're applying our direct-to-consumer marketing expertise to make access to quality care and medication convenient, cost-effective, and simple. Our brands are intensely focused on our patients, constantly striving to deliver a better end-to-end healthcare experience through technology. Our mission is to improve the health and happiness of our patients through telehealth.




About The Role




Life MD is looking for an experienced content designer/creator for email/sms marketing with the passion and know-how to nurture leads to drive acquisition, retention, and deliver a great experience through our life-cycle campaigns across our family of brands. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of writing content and laying out creative storyboards for email/SMS campaigns. The candidate will also have to demonstrate the ability to use an applied analytics approach to meet performance metrics, while leveraging multiple campaign strategies throughout our communication platforms.




Responsibilities




Produce well-researched content for email, SMS, and call campaigns
Create messaging strategies to increase CTA’s and conversions
Design and storyboard content for marketing automation journeys
Manage new campaign efforts from ideation through execution and optimization
Analyze data within ESP and platforms to provide weekly updates for CAO/CMO
Utilize data to make informed optimizations
Build a thorough long-term plan for lifecycle efforts
Keep an organized log of optimizations and historical data to drive strategic changes over the course of campaigns
Communicate with the team about data analysis, creative requests, timelines, etc.
Participate and engage in team meetings to plan out future creative campaigns
Work closely with design & copywriting team members to implement thorough creative testing processes and report against results




Requirements




Proven record of excellent writing demonstrated in a professional digital portfolio
Demonstrated experience working with data to drive campaigns and inform strategy while executing cross-channel marketing campaigns (email, in-app, push, SMS)
1-3 years of Email Marketing experience in a D2C environment required; e-commerce, subscription or B2B is also a plus
Self-motivated, and ability to work independently with little or no daily supervision
Excellent cross-functional communication, organizational, and project management skills
Impeccable grasp of the English language
Proven record of how to use personalization in customer communications
Experience using Adobe Creative Suite and storyboarding platforms like Figma
Understanding of Responsive Email Design using HTML and CSS
1+ year of experience designing marketing communications and e-commerce automation journeys using platforms like Braze
Bonus points if you’ve worked in telehealth, healthcare, or a subscription-based business




Benefits




Salary Range: $100,000-$150,000
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Commuter Benefits
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Training & Development
Free Food & Snacks

Job_title: Senior Data Scientist (US Remote Only- No Sponsor)
Job_description:
Company Description




Our goal is to advance healthcare through data science. Our passion is providing high-impact, user-friendly technologies, and analytics. We are motivated by results. Our specialized healthcare intelligence solutions are essential to finding practical knowledge that advances patient outcomes, motivates physician productivity, and enables success with value-based payment models. We provide clinically sophisticated solutions that result in outcomes that have a real impact on real people.




Job Description




As a Data Scientist, you will work with our client services and product delivery teams to build data solutions to feed our healthcare performance-measurement and analytic web applications. These applications help our clients optimize the quality and cost-efficiency of hospital and specialty care.




We are looking for technical, organized, and strong communicators to facilitate product delivery for our clients. This includes all aspects of analytic projects including: designing analytic plans, dataset preparation, data quality validation, analytic programming, and the interpretation and communication of findings. We are looking for strong data scientists with SQL and Python programming abilities, problem-solving, and excellent communication skills.




Our clients include hospitals and health systems, collaborative quality initiatives, and professional societies across various surgical specialties, health plans, and accountable care organizations.




Manage and analyze large data sets including clinical registries, administrative data, billing claims, insurance and other data sets and statistical analysis
Develop clear and well-structured analytic plans
Create efficient and reusable code to manipulate and analyze data
Build statistical models and diagnose, validate and improve the performance of the models




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree (Information, Operations Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, IT, or Computer Science majors preferred)
At least 2-3 years of analytic programming experience, preferably in healthcare
Ability to assess technical challenges and program solutions, and solve complex problems
Proven experience in a collaborative team environment and be flexible in taking on multiple projects
Strong experience coding in data manipulation and analysis using Python, SQL and/or SAS
Strong written and oral communication skills
Record of academic and/or business achievement
Currently resides in the East Coast US
No Sponsorship




Additional Information




ArborMetrix is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its selection and employment practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, or other non-merit factors.




All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

HEAD OF GROWTH – USA REMOTE




ABOUT US:




Alleyoop is an award-winning beauty brand that’s redefining multifunctional with easy and efficient products that do more than one thing - helping you save time, money, and space. We’re simplifying beauty so you can spend less time in front of the mirror, and more time doing whatever brings joy to your world. We’re also a clean, vegan, cruelty-free, and eco-friendly brand -- using on average 51.9% less raw materials vs traditional products in the beauty industry!




As a digital-first brand, we’re looking for a dynamic, creative and experienced Head of Growth responsible for leading, developing and executing the company’s acquisition marketing strategy across all digital channels while at the same time leveraging their keen eye for innovative design to elevate the brand forward.




WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:




Lead the development, planning, and execution of a 360-degree marketing plan that encompasses digital customer acquisition campaigns across all social & non-social channels (paid search, display, native, remarketing, affiliates, referrals, and email)
Drive sustainable, controlled growth through a data-driven and systematic approach to acquisition and retention
Create and test new funnels, landing pages, offers, creatives, and audiences to maximize ROAS
Lead reporting and analytics across all channels and own the performance of all relevant KPI's (LTV, CAC, contribution margin, channel ROAS targets, retention cohorts, customer churn feedback, etc)
Develop an experimentation and testing framework for new channels
Lead and manage the development and growth of an in-house growth team, and any




freelancers, agencies, etc as needed
Contribute to CRO strategies in collaboration with designers and developers
Manage a budget and measure success with analytics to maximize ROI
Develop launch strategies with the Brand & Product Development team for new




products and product categories




WHO YOU ARE:




Be obsessed with all things growth. You keep up with the latest growth trends and blogs, and meet with other marketing leaders on your spare time because of your desire to succeed.
Want to drastically improve metrics and seek out new marketing channels, never relying too heavily on one channel for growth.
Have at least 3 years of prior experience as the lead marketing person on your team.
Have at least 5 years of experience in DTC growth marketing/customer acquisition.
Be a friendly, no-ego doer.
Be data-driven. We don't speak other languages.
Be able to work and think independently.




WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US:




We value culture over everything and look for managers who can inspire others and help cultivate their leadership skills.
We’re a high-energy, creative, contagiously enthusiastic & positive team that encourages and motivates each other to live the best version of our personal and professional selves every day.
Like our products, we’re ambitious, overachieving, and multi-tasking. And like our brand, we’re funny, supportive, and don’t take ourselves very seriously.
Competitive compensation and the opportunity to join a fun and growing team
Leadership team that offers a dynamic and energetic environment to grow and develop
Distributed team
Unlimited PTO policy
100% coverage of Blue Shield medical benefits
End-of-week gratitude sessions to celebrate all of our team’s weekly wins!




Alleyoop is dedicated to promoting diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and any other protected status as required by applicable law. We strive to be a place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work!

This is a remote, work-from-home position**

Staffmark Workforce Solutions offers this exciting contract opportunity at a global leader in electronics, mobile devices and appliances located in Bellevue, WA.

Data Analyst

Responsibilities:

Create and maintain financial modeling and prepare for monthly financial submissions with Category Managers
Support Category Manager with promotion performance analysis tracking promotion spend, performance, lift, CPIR
Interface with Machine Learning/AI team to maximize promo ROI via price elasticity modeling
Support Supply Chain Manager with Forecast Accuracy analysis and reporting, provide promotion performance insights
Build and maintain Tableau and Excel based dashboards and share out to team/leadership as needed
Prepare Weekly Business Review reporting tracking standard business metrics and sales performance
Prepare Promotion Financial summaries and submit for financial approval as needed by Category Managers
Compile weekly forecasts from Category Manager and Supply Chain managers for tracking forecast accuracy metrics
Analyze and report on site traffic and conversion rates as related to promotion activity
Analyze and report on Gift Certificate spend and attach rates of purchase products
Analyze Trade-in Program promotions and track attach rates, device mix, cost and recovery
Prepare and submit documentation for promotion approval - TIM/PUMI submissions
Build Tableau dashboards and reporting ad-hoc as needed by Category Manager and Supply Chain Manager


Requirements:

Strong proficiency in Tableau is required, with experience building and publishing dashboards meeting varied business needs
Experience supporting a sales/marketing team in a data-centric role
Experience tracking and analyzing sales promotion performance
General understanding of business finance terminology and P&L
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and support a fast-paced team
5 - 7 years of relevant work experience required
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, building advanced modeling preferred
Proficiency in Excel Power Query desired
