Job DescriptionAbility to formulate functional and technical requirements from business problemsBuild data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate unorganized data into databases or data sources that are ready for analysisDesign and implement data solutions by defining functional capabilities, security, back-up, and recovery specificationsWork through all stages of a data solution lifecycle, e.g., analyze / profile data, create conceptual, logical and physical data model designs, architect and design ETL, reporting and analyticsDefine standards, best practices, and certification processes for data objects.Conduct performance tuning and optimization of data processing and storage, Write complex queries that can scale to meet requirement.

OUR MISSION




The availability of public data is growing at exponential rates, creating unprecedented opportunities for data analytics and information arbitrage. The Vertical Knowledge (VK) platform enables our customers to access and understand information that is publicly available but very challenging to identify and capture at scale. It provides organizations in both public and private sectors with a significant strategic advantage, transforming the way they discover, collect, and deploy Publicly Available Information (PAI) to solve their most challenging problems. We are constantly adapting to a rapidly changing landscape, and our customers depend on our innovation, proprietary technology, expertise, and support to consistently deliver the value of PAI.




At VK we hire talented people and then give them the opportunity and support to make an impact. Working at VK means standing at the forefront of technology that enables organizations across the private and public sectors to harness PAI (Publicly Available Information, also known as public data) - the fastest-growing type of alternative data in the world.




As the saying goes, when everyone’s digging for oil, it’s good to be in the drill business. Data is today’s oil and VK builds the most sophisticated and powerful drilling technology in the market.




VK is based in Chagrin Falls, outside of Cleveland, OH. (home of Calvin & Hobbes, Superman and the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame). We are a mission-driven organization that takes pride in knowing that our work has the potential to literally save lives.




Summary




We're looking for a skilled Data Scientist who will be responsible for applying technical expertise to execute meaningful analysis using specialized methodologies and tools to support our customer's mission and operations. The position will report to the Chief Data Strategy Officer.




The data scientist role includes data model development, analysis, testing, and creating derived data product, working closely with internal and external customers to understand their questions and needs.




The Data Scientist role is responsible for data processing, engineering, analysis tasks, analyzing information, identifying trends, and creation of data models. The Data Scientist role will gain insight into key business problems and deliverables by applying statistical analysis techniques to examine structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources.




Primary Responsibilities




Use Python, SQL, visualization tools and other data science IDEs to query, transform, analyze, and combine datasets in support of solving problems and implementing research ideas across industries and data categories
Enhance our platform through the creation of tools and processes that streamline, scale, and standardize our ability to evaluate, clean, analyze, and disseminate data
Work with cross-discipline teams to ensure connectivity between various data sources and business problems
Communicate highly technical methods to non-technical stakeholders and translate open-ended questions into data-driven answers
The Data Scientist role will work well with peers of similar experience as well as senior managers and juniors that need mentoring


QUALIFICATIONS




2 or more years of experience in a data science or research function
B.S. Degree in a STEM, quantitative or analytical field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, or Computational Social Science; or combination/equivalent work experience and/or military training with a Masters Degree in Data Science
Strong technical data aptitude coupled with a strong understanding of the business value open-source data contributes to solving complex problems
Possess both an understanding of real-world mission/business objectives and a working grasp of software development practices and technologies
Must be a skilled communicator, with well-developed verbal, written and presentation ability to communicate data narratives to technical and non-technical audiences
Customer service oriented with a demonstrated desire to meet expectations and the ability to serve multiple internal and external customers and deliver an excellent experience.
Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Transferable experience in quantitative research, data science, data research, or similar functions is preferred
Experience using structured and unstructured databases
Experience in data mining and statistical analysis
Software programming knowledge (e.g. R, Scala, SQL and Python)
Understanding of data architecture, table hierarchy and data relationships
Ability to perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies
Project management skills/experience a plus
Experience with Agile software development methodologies (e.g. JIRA) a plus
This position requires that the candidate selected must be a U.S Citizen, and have the ability to obtain/maintain a U.S. DoD Top Secret Clearance
Position may be based in our office in Northeast Ohio or remote anywhere in the U.S


COMPETITIVE BENEFITS & SALARY




Company paid premiums for employees and their dependents, such as medical, dental, vision, disability and life
Employer Health Savings Account (HSA) contributions
401(k) retirement plan with financial planning
Unlimited vacation days
Flexible work schedules
A casual work environment and dog friendly office (Ohio HQ only)
A fully stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages (Ohio HQ only)


Vertical Knowledge L.L.C. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. VK is committed to the policy of an equal employment opportunity in recruitment, hiring, career advancement, and all other personnel practices. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, genetic information, disability, past or current military service, or national origin.




Reasonable Accommodations for Applying




Applicants who qualify under the Americans with Disabilities Act, as Amended, may be eligible for a reasonable accommodation in Vertical Knowledge LLC application and selection processes. If you require an accommodation in applying through our online system, please send an email to Careers@vk.ai. Please note that this email address is not to be used for checking on the status of an application.

Senior-Level (12 To 18 Years Experience)

Overview: The team seeks a highly motivated Intelligence Assessment Analyst (Senior Level) to join our team to provide the following expert support to an Intelligence Community (IC) client:

Draft expert quantitative and qualitative analytic assessments across collection reporting, analytic production, and intelligence requirements
Develop advanced analytic methods to assess the IC’s state of collection, analysis, posture, and progress against intelligence information needs
Provide support, reviews, analysis, and feedback on evaluation related issues
Assist with the development and maintenance of databases and automated tools to manage the compilation, analysis, and communication of national intelligence priorities
Assist with the development and maintenance of databases and automatic cools to extract, analyze, and visualize data from various IC databases in support of assessments of IC performance in analysis and collection
Recommend innovative solutions to data extraction, storage, search and analysis challenges based on best practices from industry and the IC


Requirements

Skill Requirements:

Experience drafting clear and concise products describing complex data and analysis;
Experience in generating reports, charts, and plots of distributions and trends, descriptive statistics, and complex statistical analysis;
Experience in working effectively in analytic teams;
Experience developing custom scripts, queries, or visualizations to support analysis of IC data;
Understanding of descriptive statistics, regression, and classification models;
Experience conducting data extraction, parsing, manipulation, and analysis of larger volumes of data from various IC databases;
Experience designing IC solutions based on user requirements;
Knowledge of IC cloud services.


Desired Skills:

Experience in drafting evaluation reports, using enterprise integration, and metrics;
Substantial demonstrated experience applying quantitative and qualitative analytic methods, including the design, development, and management of statistical models and enterprise-wide evaluations;

The Opportunity




Pura, based in Pleasant Grove, UT, has been revolutionizing the fragrance and IOT (internet of things) connected experience in homes (and soon car) for the past several years. We obsess over providing world-class product experiences for our customers, partners, and vendors. We pride ourselves on maintaining a team-based culture of quality, innovation, and frequent growth and development!




We are currently hiring for an SEO Manager position to lead our SEO strategy and execution across our website experiences.




Who you are committed to being:




Outcomes focused with a passion for delivering value to the business
You are comfortable establishing and evangelizing a desired end state, or outcome, and motivating others to come along
You ask detailed and specific questions, understand nuance, and challenge conventional wisdom
Ability to deliver results in evolving framework with shifting priorities and technology
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop and manage relationships with cross functional team members
Strong analytical skills with an emphasis on Retail math
You thrive in a fast-paced environment that is experiencing incredible growth




What you’ll own:




Plan SEO projects, establish realistic timelines, communicate with stakeholders, manage vendor resources, and deliver measurable results
Partner with our creative teams to design, plan, create, and share valuable content for current and future Pura Owners
Optimize the technical implementation of the website to increase its organic search performance
Implement specialized techniques and methods that encourage backlinking to the Pura website
Use CRO tools to test new content for the purpose of increasing conversion rates and driving revenue
Partner with the Website team to optimize individual web pages to enhance their visibility in organic search results
Leverage website tools to publish SEO-optimized content and perform other content setup tasks




Experience you’ll need:




5-7 years of experience in SEO management for a consumer packaged goods company
Strong experience with creating a strategic roadmap to deliver our long term SEO goals
Experience facilitating cross-functional teams, including vendors, with a strong sense of accountability and how to drive a project forward
Demonstrated ability to speak on a technical level and communicate clearly with engineers, designers, copy writers, and data analysts
An analytical approach to understanding performance and testing new features for conversion rate optimization
Have a strong understanding of HTML and CSS to ensure SEO best practices for all web page development
Shopify experience preferred
IoT, Health & Wellness, or Fragrance experience preferred




Pura’s Story




Pura—a company that married smart-home technology and fragrance diffusers, all controlled by the Pura app. At Pura, our mission is to create a luxury fragrance experience in each home that can change moods and brighten days. We are partnering with the leading premium fragrance brands, celebrities and lifestyle brands in the industry to bring customers’ favorite scents to their home with the touch of a button. And that’s just the beginning.




Check out on our website, and explore the latest amazing fragrance launches on Instagram.




Pura started in 2014 and raised a seed round of 4.4M in February of 2020. Pura thrives on hiring or creating the best talent, known as a young and hungry brand that is rapidly becoming a household name around the world.




Join the Pura Team!

Title: Data and Assessment Specialist




Salary Range: $2,544 - $4,205 per month




Contract Term Length: 12 Months




Standard Hours: 37.5




Work Location: On-Site




FLSA Status: Exempt




College: Bluegrass Community & Technical College




Campus Location: Bluegrass C&TC - Newtown Pike




Department: Adult Education




Benefits




Bluegrass Community & Technical College offers a competitive benefits package and an attractive work environment that supports excellence, innovation, and creativity including:




Exceptional health care, vision, dental coverage for you and your family
Tuition reimbursement/waiver for you, your spouse, and dependents
403(b) retirement plan: a 5% employee contribution receives a 10% employer match
Vacation/Sick Time
Work-Life Balance
9.5 Paid Holidays
2 Weeks Institutional Closing Pay (Last 2 weeks of December) for qualifying positions
Employee Assistance Program




Job Summary




Working collaboratively with the Testing Center Program Coordinator, the Adult Education Data and Assessment Specialist processes a strong understanding and experience with the data collection process, report designs and analyses, Microsoft Office Suite, assessment practices, and presenting information to others. On a day-to-day basis, this individual will administer assessments, enter and review data, ensure program compliance, answer data-related questions for staff, and run and analyze reports to improve program effectiveness and efficiency. The AE Data and Assessment Specialist reports to the Testing Center Program Coordinator.




Job Duties




Implements and ensures proper data collection policies and procedures.
Enters procedure-related data into the KYSU data delivery system.
Adheres to data quality standards and ensures compliance.
Educates staff and partners on the importance of data collection processes and tools.
Understands and applies privacy law and standards.
Administers and interprets appropriate diagnostic assessments for adult students.
Proctoring and scoring diagnostic assessments for adult students.
Assists in the security and maintenance of test materials.
Assists in preparing student folders and maintaining records of student progress.
Participates in retention and follow-up activities.
Works as an effective member of the team to ensure the success of all students.
Cross trained in multiple areas, such as administrative support and assessment to ensure continuity of services.
Other duties as assigned.




Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree (related field) or four years of direct adult education related job experience may be substituted for education.
Post-Secondary transcripts




Preferred Qualifications




KAERS Experience.
Experience working in Adult Education.
Self-starter.
Prior proctoring and instructional experience.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills.

Description

Job Description:

We are in search of a Business Analyst Intern who has experience in business practices and processes to join our team supporting a contract at the Indian Health Service (IHS), an agency within the Department of Health and Human Services.

Leidos is seeking a talented Business Analyst Intern who is ready to apply knowledge of business practices and processes in a fast-paced, real-world environment. This paid internship is full-time for a minimum of 8 weeks or maximum of 12 weeks during the summer depending on interns’ availability. The intern will assist in writing reports, conducting research, analyzing data, gathering requirements, and making recommendations to improve project operational effectiveness and efficiency. This will be a valuable experience for any student pursuing a career in business administration. The 100% telework position supports a contract for IHS that deploys an electronic dental record (EDR) system across the CONUS and Alaska, serving 1.6 million American Indians and Alaska Natives.

At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers’ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business. If this sounds like a mission you want to be a part of, keep reading!

Every position one takes is more rewarding when the “why” behind the position it is better understood. Know that your work makes a difference to those who need it most. Find your passion in a team environment where all members are valued. We are excited for you to take your place in our Leidos Family. Find your “Why” with us!

Primary Responsibilities

Analyze business goals, objectives, and needs.
Help plan and design business processes and make recommendations for improvement.
Perform research and analysis in support of program operations.
Estimate benefits of actions and/or solutions and provide recommendations.
Prepare reports and presentations of program data findings and recommendations.
May perform additional projects upon request.

Education & Qualifications

Must currently be pursuing a degree in Business Administration from an accredited college/university
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Experience with Microsoft Office suite of applications
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Good analytical skills
Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust clearance.
US citizenship or permanent residency required

Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with business process improvement methods
Two years of academic or professional work experience

Pay Range

Pay Range $44,200.00 - $68,000.00 - $91,800.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Our Goal

Ensure no property is bought, sold, held, or rented without an accurate, property specific climate risk assessment.







The Problem

The problem with climate risk today is that there is no easy, accurate, accessible, and trusted way to understand physical climate risk at a property level. Climate based disasters cause billions in property damage every year and are increasing dramatically. The best science highlighting the issue is complex, happening in silos, and left in peer reviewed journals. Because of this, millions of Americans are making the biggest investment decision of their lives without a true understanding of their risk.




Risk Factor (riskfactor.com) solves this problem for flooding, wildfire, and extreme heat and we are just getting started. Not only do we have millions of users, in two short years we have seen Risk Factor integrated with top real estate websites like Realtor.com, adopted by 30+ Federal government agencies, used daily by top institutional investors like Nuveen, and leveraged in portfolio analysis by all Federal Reserve Banks.







The Opportunity

We have started a revolution in climate risk data, we have proven product market fit, and we have millions in ARR while still staying true to our non-profit climate mission. We are trailblazing a path to create a new philanthropic model that moves away from donors and is entirely self-sustaining ensuring predictable revenue and continued growth and impact. It is with this foundation that we want to supercharge growth. To do this, we are looking for an expert Data Engineer to join our team.







The Role

The Data Engineer must be someone who deeply cares about the environment, loves information technology, and appreciates the importance of data for the success of the First Street mission. The Data Engineer will lead the ingestion of climate risk and ancillary data from First Street modeling and data partners, develop data pipelines, manage geospatial databases, calculate applicable statistics, implement Quality Assurance and Quality Control processes, utilize geographical imagery, and ensure that the Data Team’s databases and pipelines are coordinated and synchronized with the Software Engineering Team’s databases, APIs, and web services. This individual will be responsible for developing data operations across the Data Team, and through their expertise and leadership generally enabling all members of the Data Team to be successful in their roles.







What’s in it for you?

For your hard work you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, bonuses based on company growth goals, generous paid time off, a stipend to deck out your home workstation and the opportunity to work for the most trafficked climate risk website in the country.




Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Provide technical leadership in the processing, analysis, and interpretation of geospatial observations and modeling data.
Process large volumes of flood and wildfire risk prediction data to improve risk assessment quality and accuracy.
Plan, execute and direct UNIX-based workflows on local and cloud-based clusters, using GDAL, PostgreSQL, Python, QGIS, Matlab, and R.
Analyze raster and vector data at scale to improve model accuracy, identify quality control issues, and develop suggested remedies for identified issues.
Perform statistical analysis to validate hazard model predictions and assess model uncertainties.
Implement quality assurance checks on the climate risk data and derived statistics
Provide technical leadership on data operations, geospatial programming, databases and statistics, including but not limited to devising risk score methodologies and metrics, community risk assessments, property vulnerability measures, and novel approaches to the derivation of new First Street climate risk information products.







Experience / Competencies

Data operations: Expertise with the design, maintenance, and use of geospatial databases, such as PostgreSQL
GIS knowledge: Expertise with working with spatial data and GIS software such as QGIS
Programming: Proficiency with SQL queries to efficiently and reproducibly analyze complex datasets preferred. Additional languages like Python or R also required
Strong understanding of probability and statistics as applied to spatial data
Expertise using scripted languages to build data pipelines on both local and cloud-based systems
Expertise with big data analysis, parallel processing, and batch/spot workflows on cloud platforms including AWS, GCP, and/or Azure
Proficiency with source control platforms such as Git
A science-based approach with a high degree of concern for reliability, accuracy and reproducibility
Experience in GIS and/or geospatial statistical analysis
2+ years of experience
Bachelor’s degree; Master’s preferred







Our Values

Passion: We are driven by our shared goal to fight climate change
Inclusion: We believe the best decisions consider many points of view
Impact: We only focus on things that move the needle
Urgency: We move quickly because the world depends on it
Integrity: We use open science and operate transparently
Positivity: We are optimistic and enthusiastic in all that we do




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Clearance: Current TS/SCI with CI Polygraph (REQUIRED)

In addition this position is responsible for analysis and definition of mail codes and training staff on their use. This is a full-time non-exempt position to be located in Chamberlain, SD or Sioux Falls, SD.




Accountability

Asset-Map is an advisor-facing fintech company that visualizes a household’s complete financial

inventory on one page. With thousands of financial professionals having mapped over 1 million

people, comprising over $1.4 trillion in financial instruments on the platform, Asset-Map is

paving the way to become the world-wide standard for personal and professional finance

management.




Asset-Map is looking for a Data/Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

This is an important role with the opportunity to make a significant impact on the direction of our

Platform and on this rapidly growing company and the millions of people experiencing the

platform worldwide.




What You’ll do as the Data/BI Analyst

The Data/BI Analyst will be responsible for assisting the Data and Operations team with helping

to understand the effectiveness and impact of former, current and proposed business decisions.

The person in this position will work closely with the Director of Analytics and Operations to

design reporting tools, update and maintain data sources, relay updates via clear visualizations,

and report findings and recommendations to decision makers across the organization.




A successful person in this role will be able to collaborate with stakeholders within and outside the

organization, while also independently driving their projects forward and maintaining their

responsibilities.




Primary Responsibilities

● Insight generation - generate insights that improve the business through linking various

data sources (sales, competitor, market, customer, etc.)

● Business analysis - analyze brand performance and sales trends, including promotion

and test analysis

● KPI reporting - create and maintain reports that assess ongoing business performance,

leading indicators, and explanatory factors

● Acquire, clean and maintain data from various sources across the organization

● Help with the design of collecting data from new operational sources

● Assist leaders with making effective decisions based on unbiased, data-based analyses

● Assist in reporting KPIs to department heads, ensuring that performance is clearly

understood

● Continuously improve data collection techniques through new processes, visualization

tools and analytical tools

● Assist the COO in financial performance tracking, reporting and forecasting

● Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to collect data, communicate and

visualize findings, and make recommendations

● Link figures and generate findings from various data sources across multiple tools and

departments

● Design, build and maintain reporting tools to better understand current, past and

proposed business strategies

● Encourage cross-departmental collaboration among Sales, Marketing, Customer

Success and Product Development departments through multi-layered analysis and

reporting




Required Qualifications and Skills

● Bachelor’s degree in Business/Finance, Statistics, or Computer Science; or 3-5 years of

commensurate business intelligence/ data analysis experience

● Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, roll up your sleeves and maintain a positive,

solution-oriented attitude, with a focus on clear communication

● Excellent analytical and business strategy skills

● Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel

● Effective communication skills

● Proficient in visualization tools

● Knowledgeable around data cleaning, manipulation and storytelling

● Excellent written and verbal communications skills

● Solid organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects at one time

● Self-starter who also has a demonstrated ability to work successfully in team

environment and drive




Other Valued Qualities and Skills

● Experience in the following tools: Quicksight, Hubspot, Klipfolio, Chartmogul, Survicate

● Demonstrated experience in reporting findings and recommendations to decision makers

● A passion for Financial Services technology (aka FinTech), and/or Financial services

experience; including but not limited to investments, life insurance, annuities, and other

financial instruments.




Compensation: Salary commensurate with experience. Incentive based bonus plan available

for certain roles. Commission plan where appropriate.




We are currently hiring candidates who live in one of the following US states: CA, TX,

PA, NY, NJ, TX, NC, SC, GA, MT, TN, WI, OH, MI, FL, VI, DE, CO, IN, MN.




Benefits: Employer subsidized health and dental insurance. Employer-provided short- and long-

term disability coverage and life insurance. 401(k) plan with employer matching contributions.

All full-time employees participate in the Employee Stock Option Plan




Hours and Location: This is a full-time position, our offices are located in Old City Philadelphia.

A full-time virtual work schedule is in effect at Asset-Map, in response to the COVID-19

pandemic. Some in-office hours are preferable for leadership positions, once conditions permit.




Reports: This position will report directly to the Director of Analytics and Operations. This

position has no direct reports.




No employment agencies, please.

Asset-Map Holdings Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.




Information: For more information on Asset-Map or other career opportunities with us, please

visit our website at www.asset-map.com.

Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

At John Hancock, data scientists work collaboratively with data and machine learning engineers, IT, and subject matter authorities to create analytical models and data architectures to solve the most pressing business problems. Working within a modern MLOps framework, data scientists are constantly delivery value by deploying their solutions in cloud-based production environments.

The Opportunity

The data scientist is accountable for delivering business value with data by focusing on key corporate objectives, including portfolio optimization, expense efficiency, growth acceleration, digital customer leadership, fraud detection, and high-performance of the team. The data scientist is a business value enabler bridging between data assets, technology, and business expertise. The data scientist is responsible for designing, building, and deploying business interpretable and performant analytics solutions and applications. The data scientist works closely with data and machine learning engineers to deploy systematic, modular, and scalable, self-service capabilities to continuously increase the capacity of the advanced analytics team to deliver value. The data scientist leverages and shares their deep knowledge of, and experience with, a wide variety of data analytics practices and methods. The data scientist helps others to improve their knowledge and understanding of the use of data and technology.

Responsibilities

Bridging between data assets, technology, and business expertise

Collaborate shoulder-to-shoulder with business experts.
Understand the business, the associated processes, systems & data environment.
Research, explore, and experiment with data driven business ideas.
Research & leverage published material to gain a comprehensive understanding of data science practices and methods.

Designing and building business interpretable and performant analytics solutions

Develop and implement data analytics enabled solutions to improve and re-imagine business process, to generate insights, and support strategy development.
Work on problems of diverse scope and complexity requiring the in-depth analysis of data.
Quickly develop enough business insight to connect data sources across multiple diverse and complex systems.
Generate relevant, actionable insights based on iterative data analysis, translating data-driven output into business language, and making appropriate recommendations to business partners.
Work closely with business teams and data science engineers to collaboratively build and deliver rich data content for analysis.
Deploy rich data and analytics content in business applications.
Understand how the analysis of data impacts a broader business strategy, including the core drivers of business value.
Prepare cases on the benefits of the analytics work.

Elevate data and analytics skills in the business

Help business partners better understand the use of data, drawing on a thorough understanding of and experience with data analytics and predictive modeling.
Identify and guide natural data champions in the business to enhance the profitable use of data.
Learn salient business concepts from data champions and enable them to creatively use data assets.

What motivates you?

You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit.
You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.
You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.
You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.
You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.
You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone.

Basic Qualifications

What we are looking for

Masters in quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or equivalent)
Knowledge and expertise with SQL with Oracle, MySQL, and Relational Databases
Skilled with Java, C++, or other programming language, as well as with R, SAS, MATLAB, Python, Julia or similar languages
2+ years of experience working in data science in a consumer product company working with Machine Learning Scientists, Data Scientists, Research Scientists, Applied Scientists, or equivalent fields

Preferred Qualifications

A PhD in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Machine Learning, Bioinformatics AI, Statistics, or equivalent)
Practical experience in several of the following areas: machine learning, NLP, statistics, experimental design, deep learning, recommendation systems,
Knowledge and experience in network and graph based analytics techniques including graph databases
Functional knowledge of Azure Cloud Platform such as Azure ML and Data Factory
Ability to distill informal customer requirements into problem definitions, dealing with ambiguity and competing objectives
Superior verbal and written communication skills, ability to convey thorough mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts
Excited about working in a diverse group and contributing to an inclusive culture.

What can we offer you?

A competitive salary and benefits packages.
A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.
A focus on growing your career path with us.
Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.
Professional development and leadership opportunities.

Our commitment to you

Values-first culture: We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.
Boundless opportunity: We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.
Continuous innovation: We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.
Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives.
Championing Corporate Citizenship: We build a business that benefits all stakeholders and has a positive social and environmental impact.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock And Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Salary & Benefits

The annual base salary for this role in the primary location of Boston, Massachusetts is expected to be between $83,440.00 USD - $154,960.00 USD.

If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.

Manulife/John Hancock offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension/401(k) savings plans and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in the U.S. includes up to 11 paid holidays, 3 personal days, 112.5 hours of vacation, and 40 hours of sick time (or more where required by law) each year, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence.

Job_description:
Our Company




Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.




We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!




The Opportunity




The Fraud Data Analyst is an experienced professional that uses their technical skills to identify fraud trends, automate processes, provide data driven insights, draw conclusions and recommendations. The candidate has a passion for fraud detection and creativity providing solutions towards wide variety of business problems using data. The analyst will work with different partners across Adobe to develop outstanding fraud detection capabilities.
What you'll Do




Exceptional analytical ability and good eye for business with at least 10 years of relevant experience.
Collaborate with multi-functional data teams to develop scalable and reusable frameworks for evaluating large datasets on the most pressing business questions
Perform data analyses to gain insights and detect fraud and abuse across platforms and products.
Automate manual workflows to build efficiencies across investigations and operational workflows.
Improve tools through data analysis, technical expertise, and presentations to key partners.
Translate investigations and intel into root cause analysis to find opportunities for scale.
What you need to succeed




Master's Degree or Bachelor's Degree along with relevant experience preferably in mathematics, information systems, data analysis.
6+ years of data analytics experience.
2+ years of fraud analytics experience.
Deep Technical proficiency in SQL.
Substantial experience with data visualization platforms (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Ability to calculate fraud, risk and abuse trends.
Experience in business and fraud analytics and insights.
Ability to identify the root cause of problems and identify, propose, and recommend innovative solutions.
Ability to work in terminal environments.
Exposure to ML/AI or tools such as R, Python is nice to have.
Experience using statistics (A/B testing, regression, etc) is a plus.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $74,200 -- $165,500 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.




At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).




In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Advertising Services, and Software Development

Overview: The team seeks a highly motivated Intelligence Assessment Analyst (Senior Level) to join our team to provide the following expert support to an Intelligence Community (IC) client:

Draft expert quantitative and qualitative analytic assessments across collection reporting, analytic production, and intelligence requirements
Develop advanced analytic methods to assess the IC’s state of collection, analysis, posture, and progress against intelligence information needs
Provide support, reviews, analysis, and feedback on evaluation related issues
Assist with the development and maintenance of databases and automated tools to manage the compilation, analysis, and communication of national intelligence priorities
Assist with the development and maintenance of databases and automatic cools to extract, analyze, and visualize data from various IC databases in support of assessments of IC performance in analysis and collection
Recommend innovative solutions to data extraction, storage, search and analysis challenges based on best practices from industry and the IC


Requirements

Skill Requirements:

Experience drafting clear and concise products describing complex data and analysis;
Experience in generating reports, charts, and plots of distributions and trends, descriptive statistics, and complex statistical analysis;
Experience in working effectively in analytic teams;
Experience developing custom scripts, queries, or visualizations to support analysis of IC data;
Understanding of descriptive statistics, regression, and classification models;
Experience conducting data extraction, parsing, manipulation, and analysis of larger volumes of data from various IC databases;
Experience designing IC solutions based on user requirements;
Knowledge of IC cloud services.


Desired Skills:

Experience in drafting evaluation reports, using enterprise integration, and metrics;
Substantial demonstrated experience applying quantitative and qualitative analytic methods, including the design, development, and management of statistical models and enterprise-wide evaluations;
Knowledge of intelligence priority topics and the supporting intelligence information needs;
Experience with natural language processing tools and techniques.


Education/Experience Requirements:

Candidate must possess a bachelor’s degree OR 4 years of equivalent work experience AND 5 additional years of relevant work experience AND 2+ years of work experience within the Intelligence Community

About Viz.ai




Viz.ai is the pioneer in the use of AI algorithms and machine learning to increase the speed of diagnosis and care, covering more than 200 million lives across 1,200+ hospitals and health systems in the U.S. and Europe. The AI-powered Viz Platform is an intelligent care coordination solution that identifies more patients with a particular disease, informs critical decisions at the point of care, and optimizes care pathways and helps improve outcomes. Backed by clinical data, the Viz Platform delivers significant value to patients, providers, and pharmaceutical and medical device companies. The company was named to the Forbes 2021 Next Billion-Dollar Startups list of the 25 fastest-growing venture-backed startups and has been on the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years. For more information visit viz.ai.




The Role




The Healthcare Data Analyst will conduct independent analysis of clinical data, reimbursement models, under minimal supervision and guidance, through use of public databases to develop novel features for existing analyses and reports that support the establishment of value for new products, services, and payor strategy.




Develop documentation and create and execute work plans for analyses of high to moderate complexity in partnership with internal/ external stakeholders.
Interact with internal customers to define reporting needs and report specifications
Perform financial analyses and modeling to support new contract growth, term changes/renewals for hospitals and IDNs
Extract, clean, analyze and summarize data from various databases for reporting needs (i.e. Tableau, Salesforce,MedPar, HCUP, Definitive, etc).
Provide network contract financial results to downstream pricing team for premium pricing opportunities
Analyze and interpret healthcare utilization and financial data to address business questions regarding population health management, health and economic outcomes, quality of healthcare, and product design.




Additionally, The Data Analyst Will




Works collaboratively with key internal stakeholders, such as clinical, operations, finance, and leadership to develop actionable insights regarding market and performance trends.
Examine and verify data contained in an internal and external analytics platform to develop customer generated reports.
Supervise and assist with the completion of provider-specific dashboards and reporting for all network physicians and practices.
Develops and presents data and analytics to external stakeholders such as providers, health plans, and other customers to explain the total cost of care analyses, cost trends, and key cost of care levers
Analyzes effectiveness of clinical interventions and cost of care initiatives and collaborates with clinical and operations teams to implement improvement opportunities
Partners closely with clinical research to support economic impact analysis of RWE.
Ad-hoc data and reporting requests as needed




You Will Love This Job If




You enjoy close collaboration across multiple teams on pulling key insights from large medical data sets.
You are comfortable working with remote teams and are flexible with work schedules.
You are keenly interested in payor strategy, reimbursement processes, data and value analysis.
You are passionate about delivering quality service, knowing that quality data can impact healthcare decision making and patient outcomes.
You are eager to learn and care about your contribution to improving healthcare delivery.




Your Knowledge And Experience




Bachelor’s degree with a focus on health sciences, statistics, math, or a related field highly preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of prior experience in health care data interpretation, analysis, and reporting.
Requires advanced proficiency in MS Office, esp. Excel and Access, Unix, SQL/PL-SQL, SAS, Tableau, and/or other relational databases and visualization software with minimal supervision and support
Experience using statistical methods to evaluate healthcare claims data and experience with reporting tools strongly preferred
Strong analytical skills, strong problem-solving skills
Inspired to learn other technical skills. Have intellectual curiosity, fast learner, be a self-starter




What Success Looks Like




You are determined to continuously improve your skills and work performance.
You take responsibility for your tasks and offer your support to the larger team as needed.
You apply the Viz core values in your everyday conduct at work.
Within the first 90 days you are taking the initiative to understand current clinical science projects and engage in statistical and economic analysis along with supporting publication plans for clinical science projects




Viz offers competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401k, generous vacation, and other great benefits to full-time employees.




Viz.ai is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. If you’re applying for a position in San Francisco, review the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance guidelines applicable in your area.




As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require Viz.ai employees to be fully vaccinated before any in-person meetings unless you are exempt.

Job-Type: Contract to Hire

Referral Fee: $500

Position Overview:

As a Data Engineer you will work as part of a team to that is responsible for building, maintaining, and administering a global data warehouse. You will build data pipelines, automate tasks, and create process and tools that will allow the company to gather data from 100’s of data sources in an effort to organize, use, and report on data efficiently. You will be focused on API and ETL Development using Python and will be working with AWS, Snowflake, and SQL/SQL Server daily.

Duties & Responsibilities:API an ETL development using Python.
Configuration changes – getting access/putting EC2 and on prem instances together and deploying changes. Some Snowflake configuration and DB administration as needed.
Meet and collaborate with vendors and other data sources to address issues, get clarification, and execute on strategies.
Data validation
Required Experience & Skills:Experience with API calls and ETL Development using Python
Experience using Postman (or something similar) to set up API calls
Snowflake and/or SQL/SQL Server experience
Experience or exposure to AWS




Nice to Have Experience:

Tableau experience

Your work days are brighter here.




At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.




About The Team




Workday's Customer Experience (CX) Analytics organization is expanding to assist in steering us toward our goal of growing from $5B to $10B in revenue! The CX Analytics group is a key player in driving this growth, by providing insights when and where users need them to support decision-making and drive business outcomes. Whether via dashboards, reports, or alerts and regardless of system, this group ensures all Customer Success insights are accurate and consistent, easy-to-understand and impactful.




About The Role




The ideal candidate must have a strong data architecture/analytics background and familiarity with Workday's business data and a passion for analytics. This role is unique in that it will leverage your technical, analytical and operational skills. As a BI Analyst on the CX Advanced Analytics & Architecture team you will be tasked with developing a deep understanding of the business you support while working on the technical and operational execution of multiple initiatives. This is an excellent opportunity for the person with technical expertise who is interested in expanding their experience into analytics.




About You




Candidates must be passionate about innovative software development, motivated to work on central impactful components, eager to learn about new technologies, and not afraid to bring bold ideas to tackle problems. Note: This role is based in our Salt Lake City office and is an office based role. All candidates must be local or self-relocate.




Responsibilities:




Assist in figuring out test methodology and test data setup to ensure quality, consistency, and scalability
Work directly with agile/ Kanban software development teams to incorporate test strategies throughout the development process
Become a functional product expert for our Specialized Customer Success team acting as a stakeholder advocate and testing with an end-user perspective
Design test cases based on high level requirements and high level designs
Work closely with business owners and developers to provide guidance into automation work




Basic Qualifications




The ideal candidate is someone with speed and agility who can collaborate with cross functional groups on complex projects.




Experience building reports and dashboards in Tableau with SFDC and SQL (intermediate to advanced) a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics (or related field) or equivalent experience required. Customer Success experience a plus.
3+ years hands-on experience with analytics.
Solid understanding of relational data concepts and data modeling.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to effectively elicit and translate business requirements.




Other Qualifications




Agile experience and understanding the QA role within the model
Enterprise Applications testing experience is a bonus
Be process and detail oriented
Clear interpersonal communication skills
Experience with analytics and databases will be helpful
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or a related field is an asset

Asset-Map is an advisor-facing fintech company that visualizes a household’s complete financial

inventory on one page. With thousands of financial professionals having mapped over 1 million

people, comprising over $1.4 trillion in financial instruments on the platform, Asset-Map is

paving the way to become the world-wide standard for personal and professional finance

management.




Asset-Map is looking for a Data/Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team.

This is an important role with the opportunity to make a significant impact on the direction of our

Platform and on this rapidly growing company and the millions of people experiencing the

platform worldwide.




What You’ll do as the Data/BI Analyst

The Data/BI Analyst will be responsible for assisting the Data and Operations team with helping

to understand the effectiveness and impact of former, current and proposed business decisions.

The person in this position will work closely with the Director of Analytics and Operations to

design reporting tools, update and maintain data sources, relay updates via clear visualizations,

and report findings and recommendations to decision makers across the organization.




A successful person in this role will be able to collaborate with stakeholders within and outside the

organization, while also independently driving their projects forward and maintaining their

responsibilities.




Primary Responsibilities

● Insight generation - generate insights that improve the business through linking various

data sources (sales, competitor, market, customer, etc.)

● Business analysis - analyze brand performance and sales trends, including promotion

and test analysis

● KPI reporting - create and maintain reports that assess ongoing business performance,

leading indicators, and explanatory factors

● Acquire, clean and maintain data from various sources across the organization

● Help with the design of collecting data from new operational sources

● Assist leaders with making effective decisions based on unbiased, data-based analyses

● Assist in reporting KPIs to department heads, ensuring that performance is clearly

understood

● Continuously improve data collection techniques through new processes, visualization

tools and analytical tools

● Assist the COO in financial performance tracking, reporting and forecasting

● Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to collect data, communicate and

visualize findings, and make recommendations

● Link figures and generate findings from various data sources across multiple tools and

departments

● Design, build and maintain reporting tools to better understand current, past and

proposed business strategies

● Encourage cross-departmental collaboration among Sales, Marketing, Customer

Success and Product Development departments through multi-layered analysis and

reporting




Required Qualifications and Skills

● Bachelor’s degree in Business/Finance, Statistics, or Computer Science; or 3-5 years of

commensurate business intelligence/ data analysis experience

● Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, roll up your sleeves and maintain a positive,

solution-oriented attitude, with a focus on clear communication

● Excellent analytical and business strategy skills

● Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel

● Effective communication skills

● Proficient in visualization tools

● Knowledgeable around data cleaning, manipulation and storytelling

● Excellent written and verbal communications skills

● Solid organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects at one time

● Self-starter who also has a demonstrated ability to work successfully in team

environment and drive




Other Valued Qualities and Skills

● Experience in the following tools: Quicksight, Hubspot, Klipfolio, Chartmogul, Survicate

● Demonstrated experience in reporting findings and recommendations to decision makers

● A passion for Financial Services technology (aka FinTech), and/or Financial services

experience; including but not limited to investments, life insurance, annuities, and other

financial instruments.




Compensation: Salary commensurate with experience. Incentive based bonus plan available

for certain roles. Commission plan where appropriate.




We are currently hiring candidates who live in one of the following US states: CA, TX,

PA, NY, NJ, TX, NC, SC, GA, MT, TN, WI, OH, MI, FL, VI, DE, CO, IN, MN.




Benefits: Employer subsidized health and dental insurance. Employer-provided short- and long-

term disability coverage and life insurance. 401(k) plan with employer matching contributions.

All full-time employees participate in the Employee Stock Option Plan




Hours and Location: This is a full-time position, our offices are located in Old City Philadelphia.

A full-time virtual work schedule is in effect at Asset-Map, in response to the COVID-19

pandemic. Some in-office hours are preferable for leadership positions, once conditions permit.




Reports: This position will report directly to the Director of Analytics and Operations. This

position has no direct reports.




No employment agencies, please.

Asset-Map Holdings Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.




Information: For more information on Asset-Map or other career opportunities with us, please

visit our website at www.asset-map.com.

JDSAT, Inc. is seeking experienced data engineers to contribute to the design and buildout of data architecture to support advanced analytics services for federal clients. Applicants should have experience building enterprise-grade data ingestion solutions and, ideally, on cloud platforms like Amazon Web Services.

At JDSAT, you will be joining a collaborative and energetic team with excellent career development opportunities. You will sharpen your knowledge on challenging projects with a great deal of autonomy while operating alongside other talented Operations Research and Data Science professionals. We like to cultivate our talent and promote from within by offering a variety of leadership and advancement opportunities throughout the company. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package along with a commitment to a healthy work/life balance and meaningful work to support our employees and our clients.

Responsibilities

Assess, analyze, and organize raw data
Prepare data for use in simulation, optimization, or data science tools
Combine information from many disparate sources, conduct data validation/verification, and store the data in a manner that enables database users to intuitively join information across multiple domains
Leverage industry best practices across all relevant levels of the technology stack to include the version control system, ETL processes, and the use of AWS cloud products
Identify opportunities for new data acquisition
Interface with source data in a variety of different forms including APIs, flat file extracts, direct database querying, etc.
Apply strong attention to detail to identify errors or data quality concerns and communicate with customers in a professional manner
Act as liaison between data owners and data consumers to evaluate business needs and objectives and help data consumers understand the art of the possible
Design data auditing and data control processes to monitor the status and health of enterprise data system


Requirements

Required Skills and Abilities

Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Data Analysis, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field with minimum of 8 years’ experience working or a combination of postgraduate studies and working in a technical field as described above.
Ability to assess and profile raw data and reassemble raw data from multiple sources into a single, enterprise model
Ability to work in a consulting role, building technology and communicating with end-users and customers of varying levels of technical capability
Ability to produce high-quality, professional documentation and communication materials
Ability to build and deploy team-friendly code in SQL


Desired Skills And Abilities

Master’s degree in Analytics, Data Analysis, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
Ability to build and deploy team-friendly code written in Python and R
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Experience leveraging cloud platforms to build secure and scalable data infrastructure
Experience building batch or streaming data ingestion pipelines


Benefits

At JDSAT Inc., you will be joining a collaborative and energetic team with excellent career development opportunities. You will sharpen your knowledge on challenging projects with a great deal of autonomy while operating alongside other talented Operations Research, Data Science, and Management professionals. We like to cultivate our talent and promote from within by offering a variety of leadership and advancement opportunities throughout the company. We offer: above-market salaries; a competitive benefits package; a commitment to achieving the right work/life balance; and meaningful work to improve our employees and our clients.

JDSAT Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with a disability.

Job_title: Food Science / Ingredient Data Entry - Remote | WFH
Job_description: We are seeking a talented and driven Food Science / Ingredient Data Entry Specialist to join our client's global R&D department. This is a 12-18 month contract position, but the work can be done remotely from the comfort of your home!As a Food Science / Ingredient Data Entry Specialist, you will be responsible for entering all new international ingredient data into the SAP Recipe Development system from the Ingredient Information Form. You may also need to use Google Translate to convert the information from the native language to English. In addition, you will work closely with the Regulatory staff in other regions to ensure data accuracy and update existing ingredients in both the Recipe Development system and the new SAP Product Data Management (PDM) system based on updated vendor information. You will also be responsible for enriching ingredient data in the SAP PDM system with missing data, and work closely with two Ingredient Specialists.RequirementsExperience with data entry in SAPKnowledge of raw ingredients and/or foreign languages is preferredBachelor's degree in Food Science or NutritionData Entry/Data Analyst experienceAt our company, we value diversity and inclusivity and are committed to providing a welcoming and supportive work environment. If you are a self-motivated and detail-oriented individual who is passionate about food science and data entry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Description

WWC Global is seeking a Data Scientist supporting the Special Operations Command (SOCOM) vice commander-directed Data Stewardship Program lead by the SOCOM Command Data and Artificial Intelligence Office. The Data Scientist will have skills sets of both of a data analyst and data engineer. This candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining a data pipeline. In addition, the Data Scientist shall understand some of the most challenging processes, technologies, and can leverage a vast array of methodologies in the field, such as data mining, natural language programming, and machine learning. The Data Scientist must have a combination of skills that includes programming, mathematical modeling, statistics, and domain knowledge. They must combine an advanced math and statistics background with programming, domain knowledge, and communication skills to analyze data, create applied mathematical models, and present results in a form useful to the organization. They must also be able to understand and manipulate structured and unstructured large data sets, which requires proficiency in distributed SQL programming, relational and non-relational data queries, general programming languages (such as Python and R) and machine learning techniques.

Responsibilities Include

Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build Data environments providing data identified by other data professionals.
Apply and develop scientific methodology, statistics and algorithms to discover and frame relevant problems, hypotheses, and opportunities.
Develop predictive and prescriptive modeling, natural language processing (NLP), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), text mining and processing, clustering, forecasting methods, and other advanced statistical techniques.
Design and automate processes to facilitate the manipulation and analysis of data. Manage and integrate data across dissimilar data sets. Analyze large-scale structured and unstructured data.
Use frameworks such as Spark and Hadoop to conduct large-scale data processing. Perform statistical modeling and create data visualizations using products like Tableau, Microsoft Power BI and R Shiny.
Research, design, and implement algorithms to solve complex problems. Program using R, Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas) or similar analytical languages.
Perform data engineering, data processing and modeling techniques using cloud-based data management, data science, and ML platforms such as Databricks, IBM Cloud Pak, Cloudera, and Snowflake.
Communicate complex concepts and hypothesis to a non-technical audience through digital storytelling.


This position is contingent on contract award.

Work Environment

Moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phone and printers) and /or occasional Loud noise (airfield, large equipment).
Ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time.


Physical Demands

While performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to sit, stand, talk, and hear.
Employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers to operate a computer.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Travel

0-10% / Minimal travel expected.

Job_title: Data Support Analyst II (Data Integrity Analyst)
Job_description:
We exist for American workers and their employers -- who are the backbone of our economy. That is where Centivo comes in -- our mission is to bring affordable, high-quality healthcare to the millions of Americans who struggle to pay their healthcare bills.

Centivo is looking for a Data Support Analyst to join our team!

Centivo is looking for a Data Support Analyst, who will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and consistency of data across various sources. This role will involve building and maintaining processes that ensure data integrity, including identifying and addressing any data discrepancies, ensuring data points align across various sources, and implementing best practices for data management.

Your responsibilities will include:

Build and maintain processes that ensure data integrity, including identifying and addressing any data discrepancies, ensuring data points align across various sources, and implementing best practices for data management.
Work with end-users to confirm and fulfill reporting requirements, taking on ad-hoc reporting requests, and ensuring that reports are accurate and consistent.
Use SQL to write complex queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from multiple sources.
Use Python to build and maintain data pipelines, automate data processing, and create customized reports.
Analyze large datasets and present insights in a clear and concise manner, communicating findings to stakeholders and making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data-related issues.


Work Location:

Remote role. We would prefer candidates from Buffalo, NY.

Requirements

At a minimum, you should have these qualifications for this role:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis, data management, or a related field.
Strong SQL skills and experience with a variety of database technologies.
Experience with Python and data processing frameworks such as Pandas, Numpy, or Dask.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with large and complex datasets.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.


If you are passionate about ensuring data accuracy and consistency and have a strong technical background in SQL and Python, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Salary:

Our range for this role is $74,000- $87,000. To determine our range, we consider as many of the following data points as are available to us: external market salary survey data, internal data in terms of comparable roles and our budget for the position. Compensation is both an art and a science (as is negotiating a salary for a new job at a new company!), so what we have posted is our good faith estimate of what we expect to pay. We encourage candidates to apply for positions that are of interest and share their desired salary. We consider that as an additional data point, along with candidate skills and qualifications as part of our process.

Who we are:

Centivo is an innovative health plan for self-funded employers on a mission to bring affordable, high-quality healthcare to the millions of working Americans who struggle to pay their medical bills. Anchored around a primary care based ACO model, Centivo saves employers 15 to 30 percent compared to traditional insurance carriers. Employees also realize significant savings through our free primary care (including virtual), predictable copay and no-deductible benefit plan design. Centivo works with employers ranging in size from 51 employees to Fortune 500 companies. For more information, visit centivo.com.

Headquartered in Buffalo, NY with offices in New York City and Buffalo, Centivo is backed by leading healthcare and technology investors, including a recent round of investment from Morgan Health, a business unit of JPMorgan Chase & Co.

The Company




Our partner is comprised of a group of experts in artificial intelligence, intellectual property, and Web3 technology. They are California-based, with a remote-first team distributed across the United States, Canada, and Europe. Blockchain technology has unlocked powerful new ways to create and trade digital assets. But with this change, it's easier than ever for bad actors to defraud consumers. Our partner is building tools to protect the community, and make every interaction with a digital asset safe and transparent.




The Role




Our partner is on the hunt for an experienced Head of Content Marketing who will be responsible for developing and implementing the overall content strategy based on their market goals and objectives. As the content marketing leader you will own the thought leadership platform and strengthen customer acquisition.




As part of the leadership team, you'll bring bold and unique ideas to the table. You'll be a fast learner about markets and technology across the Web3, AI, IP, and security sectors, and will be keen to develop new community initiatives and grow the scope of content marketing.




Responsibilities




You will own the content strategy, initiatives, and outcomes with a north star of educating and onboarding brands and platforms onto our client’s services
Develop and execute a comprehensive content marketing strategy that drives key metrics across the user lifecycle from awareness, to acquisition, activation and retention
Create and manage an editorial calendar for content planning and production, and perform regular audits for content gap analysis
Develop and launch initiatives in community management, marketing analytics, social media marketing, and SEO to make data-driven decisions in growing our client’s audience




Requirements




5+ years of experience in full-stack content marketing
Mastery of the written word
Ability to balance the art of storytelling with the investigation of emerging technologies and the science of data analysis
Demonstrable impact in scaling content marketing functions and acquisition engines in prior experiences
Experience in Web3 is a plus; passion to learn about Web3 technology required




Perks




Unlimited PTO
Competitive compensation packages
Remote friendly & flexible hours
Wellness packages for mental and physical health
MUST BE LOCATED IN BRITISH COLUMBIA OR SAN FRANCISCO
