Job_title: B2B Marketing Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
Job_description: We're seeking a skilled B2B Marketing Data Analyst to join our team! As a member of our remote team, you'll have the opportunity to support lead generation data analysis at a leading tech company from the comfort of your own home.As a B2B Marketing Data Analyst, you'll play an essential role in managing lead generation, account, and contact information. You'll work on exciting projects like cross-referencing accounts for the level of activity and analyzing customer engagement and account activity. With your expertise in Excel data analysis, you'll build out B2B account information and work hands-on in Excel to cross-reference data. You'll also use Salesforce to build reports and dashboards, clone reports, and explore data to solve problems.We're looking for someone with 1-2 years of data analysis and Salesforce experience, as well as proficiency in pivot tables, VLOOKUPS, and formulas. A relevant degree is preferred, and experience working with marketing data is strongly preferred, especially in B2B/lead gen marketing data.As a member of our team, you'll enjoy a collaborative work environment that focuses on problem-solving and fosters open communication. You'll have the opportunity to enroll in our health insurance and retirement plans, enjoy paid time off and company-paid holidays, and participate in our FUEL program.

As our Data Engineer, you will function as a consultant between our technology unit and other business units to understand their challenges. You’ll ask questions and present ideas that enable them to solve those data problems with code. Our team is 100% remote, but you must be willing to travel 2 days a month for team meetings.

To thrive in this role, you must understand how to query and process large data sets of 200,000 rows or more, ideally in SQL. You must also have functional knowledge of at least 1 programming language like Python. Be prepared to share an example of how you have worked with multiple tables to develop a solution to a business problem (real or hypothetical for more junior candidates).

What You’ll Do

Every day you will begin with a set of technical specifications to begin coding solutions to issues across the business. Our team’s success isn’t just implementing the code but seeing that those insights are implemented by the business, and they have the necessary tools to accomplish the goal. More senior Data Scientists will write these technical specifications while junior applicants are doing the work to translate specs into functional code.
Ask questions and do quality testing to understand if the solution meets the objectives of the business or the goal we set for the business. You will work side-by-side with the business to make sure it works as expected, not just as designed.


What You’ll Need

To thrive in this role, you must have a passion for problem-solving using data. Your experience in querying the high volumes of data and doing the data analysis must inform how you design solutions that align with the business objectives.
Being proficient with SQL and programming languages such as Python and Spark is a must.
Experience with data integration from different sources into Big Data systems is preferable.
Experience quality testing and coding. These solutions will deploy across products that are important to our customers and the business. They must be high-quality and functional.
A willingness to collaborate. Our best work is done when we work together - either with non-technical or technical leads. You should be interested in learning from others regardless of their role in the organization.
You have worked previously with an Agile team or understand these concepts. You expect to participate in daily standup meetings, you’ll complete your projects or stories during our sprints, and

Health coverage for medical, dental, vision
401(K) saving plan with company match AND Pension
Tuition assistance
PTO for community volunteer programs
Wellness program
Employee discounts

Req ID: 208096




NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.




We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our team in Arlington, Virginia (US-VA), United States (US).




We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our team in Arlington, Virginia (US-VA), United States (US).




The incumbent will support government agency’s efforts to develop and implement effective monitoring and analysis of data related to the manufacturing and distribution of controlled substances. This effort will aid in the enforcement of relevant statutes and oversight of regulatory requirements to prevent the diversion of chemicals and pharmaceuticals.




Objectives include ensuring information/data contained in various government databases is maintained, controlled, verified and accessed appropriately; maintaining and updating information in custom developed tool(s) used to monitor controlled substance supply chain; direct/indirect support of big data analytics, detail orienting, and data scrutinizing; further agency’s investigative, statistical and predictive value of data holdings; and help develop data applications and holdings into an automated and manageable program.




Job Duties




Develop an initial action plan (IAP) requiring audit and assessment, short/long-term goals, milestones, dataset, risks, mitigations, timelines
Implement plan to include mapping out ways to best accomplish IAP -
Data quality includes reviewing, analyzing and validating data to ensure quality as well as developing reports and charts to illustrate trends, outliers, and linkages
Data collecting to include bringing together data from separate but related databases
Data analysis includes working with machine learning and AI to improve functionality, facilitate discovery of problems and trends, and create short, medium and long-term results oriented information packages and
Data reporting and validation including developing and implementing user-friendly report to assist investigators and end-users.




Basic Qualifications
Minimum 4 years of experience in intelligence research and data analysis with the following:
Minimum 2 years of experience in MS Excel, PowerBI, and/or other data analytic tools in order to design and build formulas, charts, links, pivot tables, etc.
Minimum 1 year of experience with the ability to manipulate unstructured data from different platform
Minimum 1 year of experience with data visualization tools such as Elastic X-Pack (including Graph), Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust security clearance




Preferred Qualifications




Educational background in Data Science is a plus

If this position becomes subject to a COVID-19 vaccination mandate based on applicable law or client requirement, candidates will be required to become fully vaccinated as defined by NTT DATA or be approved for an exemption in accordance with applicable law.

Job Summary




The Pricing Analyst position will support the Marketing/Product Management & Commercial Ops team by reviewing, analyzing, updating, and presenting information pertaining to ANI's products taking in account market shares and overall strategy for business growth. This position will involve frequent interaction between the Finance, Sales, and Marketing/Product Management teams to execute the day-to-day functions.




Position Responsibilities




Manage day-to-day pricing requests
Develops and prepares pricing models and corresponding account proposals ensuring they are complete in accordance with defined service levels to meet internal and external customer timelines.
Adheres to operational procedures to secure reliable data and prepare pricing scenarios utilizing established models for purposes of developing and analyzing account proposals related to products and services for his or her customer accounts.
Knowledge and understanding of the systems, data, reports and operational processes that is critical to developing account proposals and executing contracts.
Assists in the development of formal RFP responses as necessary.
Create and maintain compendia reporting to monitor price changes, new entrants and discontinuations within the ANI portfolio of products
Assist in periodic reviews of current pricing to ensure competitiveness and probability
Develops and maintains various reports; quarterly reports, monthly price/sales tracker, compliance tracker, etc
Develops specific account knowledge and understanding of contractual terms and actual performance to assist the commercial team in developing and implementing account strategies, pricing alternatives and contract language.
Knowledge and understanding of departmental data, business metrics and operational processes.
Investigate, resolve and respond to internal and external customer inquiries in regard to product or contract discrepancies




Qualifications And Skills




Bachelor’s Degree (BA/BS) in a business-related function – Required
2 - 3 years or more Contracting, Finance, Account Management or Pricing in Generic Pharmaceutical pricing - Required
Strong Microsoft Office programs with emphasis in Excel
Ability to multi-tasking
Ability to prepare, analyze and interpret general reports
Strong communication both oral and written
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers and customers




Company Overview




ANI Pharmaceuticals is an integrated specialty pharmaceutical company focused on delivering value to our customers by developing, manufacturing, and marketing high quality branded and generic prescription pharmaceuticals. We focus on niche and high barrier to entry opportunities including controlled substances, anti-cancer (oncolytics), hormones and steroids, and complex formulations. Our two pharmaceutical manufacturing facilities located in Baudette, Minnesota are capable of producing oral solid dose products, as well as liquids and topicals, controlled substances, and potent products that must be manufactured in a fully-contained environment. Our objective is to create long term shareholder value by building a sustainable and growing base business in generic and mature brand pharmaceutical products while advancing an opportunity to re-commercialize Cortrophin gel and Cortrophin-Zinc.

At StubHub, our mission is to bring the joy of live to fans globally. We’re the world's largest ticket marketplace, and we make sure that the events where you want to be are never sold out.

At StubHub, we are:

Owners – We carry the ball. We act as one team, in it together. We live above the line as optimists and with a solution mindset. We are fully accountable for solving problems, both our own pieces and the whole.

Fan First – We are the fans’ biggest fans. We are the fan and the voice of our fans in everything we do.

Driven – We push past the finish line, aggressively prioritize, and focus on what matters most. We debate, decide, commit and deliver.

Inventive – We play a new chord; we celebrate progress over perfection and learnings as much as success. We’re agile because there is always more than one way.

Courageous – We take big swings. We show up for challenges with resilience and persistence. We take risks, embrace failure as a path to learning, and speak up when we have different opinions.

Diverse & Inclusive – We harmonize. We assume positive intent, trust and empower others; bring a global mindset and seek out alternative viewpoints.

We would like to see:

3+ years of relevant analytics experience; understanding statistics, especially experimentation and causal inference
Experience with SQL
Knowledge of R or Python


We would prefer a teammate with:

Experience with A/B testing or experimental design
Ability to identify growth opportunities for our business and assist the success of our marketing
Success stories with people at all levels and across departments


You'd be able to:

Turn ambiguous questions into clear analytical problems, and solve them using data
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders on the key decisions that drive our user acquisition success
Build dashboards that give stakeholders visibility into the current state of our business
Use data to identify opportunities to improve marketing channel ROI
Establish KPIs that measure the performance of our operations and drive resource allocation


About the opportunity:

The Marketing Department at StubHub is responsible for all channels that connect users to their next live event experience. As a member of our Analytics team, you’ll be at the forefront of the experimentation and innovation that drives the growth of the business.

For over 20 years, StubHub has been the leading marketplace for fans to buy and sell tickets. Today, we continue to offer you peace of mind with our exclusive FanProtect Guarantee, best-in-class customer service, and product features that ensure we have your back. Combined with viagogo, we now span over 170 countries around the world, servicing buyers and sellers in 38 currencies and 40 different languages with our StubHub brand in North America and our viagogo brand outside of North America.

Are you interested in joining an ambitious and close-knit team dedicated to solving meaningful customer problems? Your work will have a significant impact on the business, and help spread the joy of concerts, theater, and sports around the world.

We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel StubHub is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, and included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

The anticipated gross salary range for this role is $128,500-$208,049 per year. Actual compensation will vary depending on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, experience, and competencies. Base annual salary is one component of StubHub’s total compensation and competitive benefits package, which includes equity, 401(k), paid time off, paid parental leave, and comprehensive health benefits.

Freedom for the soul. Are you ready to join us?

We maximize employee flexibility and well-being through a virtual mindset that supports our highly distributed, global workforce. We take an outcome-focused, people-centered approach to winning, including welcoming the best talent - wherever they may be.

This remote role is not tightly linked to a physical location and provides flexibility in where, when and how you accomplish your work.

The Digital Analytics Manager will be responsible for the development, management, and oversight of the Growth Hacking Digital Analyst group, building dashboards and providing reporting for the full Digital organization, data driven and actionable insights, and measurement of company and campaign performance against targets. The manager will be responsible for and oversee a team who will have a detailed understanding of the key data sources, their owners and their utilizations, and identify, build and maintain the key business metrics for the Digital team and across the business groups.

This manager must have experience driving a cohesive team to meet analytical objectives, exhibit excellent analytical skills, be detail- and solution-oriented, and tenacious in their ability to track down data to drive meaningful insights, and work well across business units.

In This Role You Will

Build and manage a team of analysts for eCommerce, Media, Website and App Reporting, & other analytics needs.
Collaborate with key stakeholders across the Digital Growth Organization including Product, Development, Experience & Design, Data Science, and eCommerce to align on needs and roadmap analytics development.
Develop analytics strategy for new website components or app features.
Estimate analytics needs for new digital products and manage and scale additional outsourced analytics resources as necessary.
Act as point of contact for all digital metrics and analytics requests from stakeholders.
Maintain Digital Marketing Analytics Database to track and prioritize all requests.
Lead multi- and omnichannel results of Digital Marketing and eCommerce initiatives across several channels, including website, media, social, mobile, email and video.
Contribute to digital campaign and web measurement strategies.
Create dashboards, reports and presentations that clearly synthesize learnings into actionable insights/recommendations.
Monitor team performance against targets and perform required deep dives when needed.
Own governance for analytical tools and processes.
Maintain knowledge and documentation on key systems and data sources.
Communicate and present findings to colleagues and senior leaders.

Your team will be responsible for eCommerce, Media, Website, and App Reporting Analytics

Tagging – Add tags to new website code and perform UAT of all code to ensure tags are firing properly. Partner closely with GIS and technical agencies to troubleshoot issues. Add tags to h-d.com pages as requested by marketing partners.
Adobe Analytics – Lead all Adobe Analytics Platform upgrades. Stay current on the platform roadmap, proactively plan for changes as needed with GIS partners, and initiate projects, including funding if needed.
Adobe Analytics Reporting – Lead development of all reports and dashboards in Adobe Analytics for business stakeholders. Simplify the Adobe Analytics interface for business stakeholders through the creation of simple campaign and on-going dashboards and reports to track the performance of overall site performance and campaigns.
Website Optimizations – Analysis of impact and performance of website changes/optimizations; provide recommendations.
Performance Marketing – Analysis of website traffic sources; provide insights and recommendations to drive business through paid media, SEM, SEO, email and other traffic drivers. Leverage Performance Marketing stakeholders including paid and email as key partners to drive recommendations into execution.
Campaign landing page performance – Analysis of page performance; provide recommendations (e.g. form conversion rate  quality of UX, quality of traffic by source, etc.)
A/B and Multi-Variate Testing – Lead development of hypotheses, partner with content and experiences teams to develop tests, configure test in Adobe Target, measure, share insights, and make recommendations.
Site Satisfaction Survey – Monitor h-d.com and App site satisfaction survey metrics and leverage data as part of holistic website performance story.

Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Advertising, Business Administration, or related area is required.

Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills
Experience working in agile and lean environments

About Ccs Fundraising

CCS Fundraising is an international strategic fundraising firm that partners with nonprofits for transformational change. For 76 years, CCS has empowered many of the world’s greatest organizations across sectors to advance some of the most important causes in history. We plan, manage, and implement programs and initiatives that achieve fundraising goals and mission impact.

CCS provides tailored support to more than 700 nonprofit organizations annually. Headquartered in New York, the firm has over 500 professionals and 18 offices throughout the United States and Europe. Our people are our greatest strength. At CCS, you will join a diverse team of smart, passionate, and resourceful professionals who are driven by purpose and committed to performance.

UNDERSTANDING THE ROLE

CCS Fundraising is seeking an analytical and detail-oriented professional to support performance management related data collection, reporting, and overall systems management. This role is aimed at ensuring our firm’s continued prioritization of the employee career journey through the prioritization of individual, title-specific, and broader firm-wide data captures and analysis.

Key Responsibilities

The Human Resources Analyst will be lead in the collection, management, and analysis of performance-related employee data. Overall responsibilities include:
Primary management of the employee performance management system and associated feedback gathering processes:
Administering the annual employee performance review process
Administering project specific feedback collection tools
Administering the executive review process, inclusive of a broader employee survey on leadership reflections
Monitoring and promoting compliance from all employees
Analyzing team, department, tenure, title-specific, and year-over-year trends and communicating findings to HR leadership
Researching and highlighting emerging industry best practices that should influence future performance management approaches
Employee exit and stay interview data collection and reporting
Ongoing reporting for “HR Fast Facts” – a monthly report issued to CCS leadership
Management of HR-related source reports for CCS’s strategic plan dashboard
Identification of additional reporting needs and associated data collection strategies to support goals of the HR leadership team
Partnership with other Human Resources pillars (e.g., Recruitment, Learning, DEI) on additional related reporting needs
Partnership with CCS’s regional teams/departments on additional related reporting needs

Necessary Skills Include

The ideal candidate combines an analytical mindset with a strength in process management and data visualization. Additional requirements include:

Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business analytics, or a related field
Previous experience as an analyst or related function
Knowledge of data hygiene, collection, and analysis best practices
Experience managing dashboards and building reporting tools
Experience with Leapsome, ADP, and other HR systems preferred
Detail-oriented work style with an ability to effectively multi-task
Strong communication skills
Comfort in a fast-paced work environment
Passion for philanthropy and serving the nonprofit sector

CCS offers competitive benefits, a dynamic training program, resources, career advancement, mentoring, and networking opportunities. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage a diverse pool of candidates to apply.

SALARY RANGE: $75,000-$90,000

Exact salary varies within salary range based on years of relevant experience and education

Additional requirements include:Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business analytics, or a related fieldPrevious experience as an analyst or related functionKnowledge of data hygiene, collection, and analysis best practicesExperience managing dashboards and building reporting toolsExperience with Leapsome, ADP, and other HR systems preferredDetail-oriented work style with an ability to effectively multi-taskStrong communication skillsComfort in a fast-paced work environmentPassion for philanthropy and serving the nonprofit sectorCCS offers competitive benefits, a dynamic training program, resources, career advancement, mentoring, and networking opportunities. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage a diverse pool of candidates to apply.SALARY RANGE: $75,000-$90,000 Exact salary varies within salary range based on years of relevant experience and education

Our Company




Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.




We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!




The Opportunity




The Fraud Data Analyst is an experienced professional that uses their technical skills to identify fraud trends, automate processes, provide data driven insights, draw conclusions and recommendations. The candidate has a passion for fraud detection and creativity providing solutions towards wide variety of business problems using data. The analyst will work with different partners across Adobe to develop outstanding fraud detection capabilities.
What you'll Do




Exceptional analytical ability and good eye for business with at least 10 years of relevant experience.
Collaborate with multi-functional data teams to develop scalable and reusable frameworks for evaluating large datasets on the most pressing business questions
Perform data analyses to gain insights and detect fraud and abuse across platforms and products.
Automate manual workflows to build efficiencies across investigations and operational workflows.
Improve tools through data analysis, technical expertise, and presentations to key partners.
Translate investigations and intel into root cause analysis to find opportunities for scale.
What you need to succeed




Master's Degree or Bachelor's Degree along with relevant experience preferably in mathematics, information systems, data analysis.
6+ years of data analytics experience.
2+ years of fraud analytics experience.
Deep Technical proficiency in SQL.
Substantial experience with data visualization platforms (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Ability to calculate fraud, risk and abuse trends.
Experience in business and fraud analytics and insights.
Ability to identify the root cause of problems and identify, propose, and recommend innovative solutions.
Ability to work in terminal environments.
Exposure to ML/AI or tools such as R, Python is nice to have.
Experience using statistics (A/B testing, regression, etc) is a plus.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $74,200 -- $165,500 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.




At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).




In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Job Summary




As a part of the Enterprise Data Engineering & Enablement team, this role will be on the front edge of the new era of data enablement across the enterprise. The Quality Assurance Analyst role will be responsible for supporting the planning and execution of system testing on simple to complex implementations. This role initiates tests, analyzes results, troubleshoots systems and collaborates with teams to find solutions to technical problems. The QA Analyst will work collaboratively within the IT department and business units to execute and validate test cases based upon system requirements. You will be working on different initiatives with internal and external customers. This role will also cross train with other inter departmental tasks.




Job Specifications




Shift & Schedule Availability: Full Time / Year Round
Outlet: Corporate
Other Specifics: Remote
The expected range is $66,100 - $87,110




Job Responsibilities




Define and execute test cases for web applications based on software requirements and technical specifications
Develops business functional and technical test plans on moderately complex application implementation and development.
Executes the testing of technology systems ensuring quality and efficient systems performance
Experience in testing websites across multiple browsers, testing web-services, back-end processing and data validation utilizing SQL and API Tools
Demonstrated experience with industry standard Quality Assurance best practices for Agile and Iterative SDLCs, testing methodologies, version control systems, implementation, and deployment activities.
Experience in: system testing, data warehouse migration testing, data integrity testing and data transformation related testing.
Creates and executes various testing documentation (including plans, conditions, and scripts) based on technical and user requirements.
Provides feedback of testing results to development teams ensuring fixes or enhancements are incorporated prior to scheduled releases.
Ensures all applications adhere to high quality standards.
Assist in the execution of integration or end-to-end testing with client systems or programs.
Research best practices to determine quality improvement initiatives and utilization standards.
Carries out complex tasks of large projects.
Record and document results and compare to expected results
Analyze testing from the client's perspective
Improve the maturity of the regression scripting and execution process
Works with an open and collaborative style
Participate in application planning meetings
Work in an Agile development team
Ability to work afterhours as needed




Job Requirements




Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
2+ years of quality assurance experience required
Experience developing and creating test cases, test plans and test scripts required
Experience writing and reading SQL
Experience with functional, regression, ad-hoc and extensive software testing
Experience with Ecommerce is required
Experience testing Responsive websites is required
Must have the ability to create and maintain test plans and test results
Self-starter and active learner
Must have excellent problem solving skills
Must be very detail oriented
Must have outstanding written and verbal communication skills




Preferred




Experience with various testing tools including automation tools is a plus
Experience with Jira and Confluence
Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS).




Soft Skills




Proactive, not reactive
Self-starter
Detail-Oriented
Proactive in finding and resolving a wide range of technical and process issues
Organized and able to track multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines for each project
Interested in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues
Able to learn a wide range of new topics simultaneously
Able to understand key details or components of complex products and seek out relevant information independently to quickly learn and understand these products in depth




The expected range is $66,100 - $87,110. Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience.

Medical, Dental, Vision insurance, and a 401(k) retirement plan
Hourly employees are generally eligible for accrued Paid Time Off (PTO), Extra Time Off (ETO) and Sick Time. Salaried employees are generally eligible for Flexible Time Off (FTO)

Healthcare & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts

Company: International Society for Stem Cell Research
Job_description:
Position: Data Specialist

Department: Information Technology

Reports To: Director of Technology & Business Operations

FLSA Status: Exempt




Position Summary

The Data Specialist is responsible for serving as the Society’s primary resource for the data management within the association management system (iMIS), and regularly liaises with staff and third-party vendors to ensure needed reporting, functionality, and processes are in place to support ISSCR operations. The Data Specialist will interact with staff at all levels and must have the interpersonal skills required to effectively understand business needs and translate those to data delivery in a timely manner to staff. This position does not have any supervisory responsibility. This position serves as point of contact to organization various departments for iMIS and other relevant systems data extraction, integrations, reporting and dashboard configuration.




About the ISSCR

The International Society for Stem Cell Research (ISSCR) is the largest society in the world dedicated to the advancement of responsible stem cell research - a field that strives to advance scientific understanding, treatments, and cures that better human health. We foster junior scientists, give voice and visibility to scientific achievement, and encourage a positive global environment for future discovery and treatment. Our promise is to help the field of stem cell science reach its potential.




Responsibilities

Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Ensures the association management system (iMIS) supports ISSCR membership structure including collection of data; join and renew/invoicing processes, member onboarding/off boarding processes, and other personalized communications.
Manages the CRM/AMS data to ensure the accuracy of member and prospect records and reports while maintaining overall data integrity, including compliance with applicable data privacy requirements.
Facilitates query development by gathering end-user requirements and creating advanced queries and reports.
Works with Director of Technology to configure the AMS by adding new fields or configuring new processes.
Assists in extraction of data from the AMS to produce email communications, surveys, mailing lists and Reports. 
Assists in maintenance and monitoring data integrity and consistency to ensure that data is “clean”, duplications are eliminated, addresses are valid, zip+4 is correct, email addresses are legitimate, and data adheres to standards.
Identifies areas of needed business process improvement and works with appropriate membership, events, education, finance, and marketing staff to implement changes.
Works with staff to develop ways to increase collection of member demographic information and with the marketing team to leverage data for segmenting and analysis.
Understands integrations between third-party systems and the AMS.
Configuration AMS Business processes aligned with ISSCR Business models.
Develops and manages operational SOPs (i.e., data entry, IQAs, automation module system, etc.)
Conducts training to ensure staff know how to use the database for reports, rosters, marketing, and other basic operations.
Serves as troubleshooter for staff as needed.
Perform related duties within the department as assigned or necessary.




Requirements

Minimum one year experience requires in data Specialist or similar role.
Experience in writing advanced queries and reports using SQL or Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services
Experience with Association Management Systems (AMS) iMIS (preferred) or a CRM equivalent
Strong experience with various data analytics and reporting tools. Create and customize reports for internal business stakeholders.
Highly capable of analysis and problem solving.
Bachelor’s degree required.
Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills with ability to communicate and interact effectively with a variety of persons and institutions.
Ability to work independently and set and manage priorities.
Proficiency with reporting software (e.g., SQL Server Reporting Services, Power BI), T-SQL, Microsoft Office as well as other software and technology tools.




Other Skills and Abilities

Possess a positive, enthusiastic attitude and a strong desire to innovate and learn new technologies and techniques.
Previous association or non-profit experience preferred.
Must possess excellent customer service skills, attention to detail, be dependable and hold discussions in a professional manner.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with all audiences at all levels.




Travel

Some travel may require, primarily to the ISSCR in-person Annual meeting.




Benefits

Health
Dental
Vision
Life
Disability Insurance
401(k)/Matching
Paid Time Off
Parental Leave
Professional Development Assistance
Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Flexible work arrangements.

Data Scientist, Internship for 2023 Spring/Summer.




At FCF Advisors, we offer a dynamic and entrepreneurial work environment where you will have the opportunity to learn and grow in the investment management industry.




We are looking for a motivated and curious Data Scientist Intern to join our team to enhance our investment risk models and help us build a risk product for financial advisors. This product will focus on evaluating client's investment risk tolerance and stress testing their current portfolios.




Responsibilities

Work closely with our product development team to design, develop and deploy machine learning models for our financial advisor product.
Develop and maintain data pipelines, conduct data cleaning, and perform exploratory data analysis.
Analyze data to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can help improve our product offerings.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data-driven solutions that address business challenges.
Participate in code and design reviews to ensure the quality and maintainability of our codebase.
Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data science and machine learning, and apply them to our product development.




Requirements

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python or R, and experience with relevant data science libraries (e.g. NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow).
Experience with database technologies such as SQL, MongoDB, or Cassandra.
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and techniques, including regression analysis, clustering, and decision trees.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to think creatively and independently.




How to Apply

If you are passionate about investment management and have a strong interest in quantitative research, we encourage you to follow us on LinkedIn and apply.

Follow us on LinkedIn and apply: https://www.linkedin.com/company/fcf-advisors/
Follow us on Twitter and apply: https://twitter.com/fcfadvisors




About FCF Advisors

FCF Advisors is a boutique Asset Management firm and Index Provider based in NYC specializing in free cash flow-focused investment strategies. Over the past decade, the firm has become a recognized leader in free cash flow analytics and research. FCF has pioneered the free cash flow quality model (FCFQM) which serves as the foundation for the firm’s quantitative investment process. FCF Advisors has a suite of core and thematic free cash flow equity strategies and offers over 50 customizable free cash flow index strategies covering 8 global equities allocation categories available in SMA/white label SMA and model delivery. https://fcf-advisors.com/, https://www.fcf-funds.com/

Index Analytics, LLC, is a rapidly growing Baltimore-based small business providing health related consulting services to the federal government. At the center of our company culture is a commitment to instilling a dynamic and employee-friendly place to work. We place a priority on promoting a supportive and collegial team environment and enhancing staff’s experience through career development and educational opportunities.Index Analytics is seeking a Data Analyst to support Government clients for remote position. The Data Analyst will be responsible for data research, analysis and generating insights for the team.Responsibilities Analyze datasets to uncover usable insights.  Work with subject matter experts to understand what data is available and how it can be used. Work with data owners to arrange the collection and use of data. Work with the team to organize and derive findings from acquired data. Work with the team to make data available to consumers.  Research and analyze data from multiple sources. Create and maintain data mapping documentation.  Work with data sets to develop strategies to find and derive information to improve system understanding.  Perform routine business analysis using various techniques (e.g. statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, data mining)  Research best practices and support development of solutions and recommendations for business operations. Use logic and reasoning to identify strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.  Provide business data interpretation, work with the internal or external client to identify analytical requirements and produce ad hoc data and reports. Bachelor’s degree or higher in IT or relevant discipline required.  3+ years of experience.  Experience in data collection, data analysis, methodology development and evaluation of health care data  Ability to analyze, transform, and join data from different data sources to derive data to inform guidance for consumers  Experience outlining work necessary for analysis of datasets and initiatives.  Good communication skills to openly communicate and work closely with a team of engineers, internal and external stakeholders, and the client.  Ability to utilize programming languages such as SQL, Java, Salesforce, Python, R, or Scala to perform data analysis is support of the development of data analytics  Strong attention to detail and accuracy.  Self-driven. Willingness to lead, take charge, offer opinions and direction. Escalates appropriately in a timely manner.
