Job_description:
Who We're Looking For:

We are looking to add a technical CSS to our support team, whose can be relied upon to handle some of the more technical inbound support inquiries that our support team encounters each day.

If you can hold your own in the world of webhooks, APIs, firewalls, networks, 500 errors, bug replication and more, and you have experience in a similar role, we'd love to interview you!

The ideal candidate for this position is a self-starter with consistent work ethic, especially when nobody is watching. The ideal candidate for this position also demonstrates strong interpersonal skills, patience and optimism, good technical skills/instincts, and the ability to learn our tech/product relatively independently and quickly.

What is Kixie?

Kixie is a venture backed start-up in Santa Monica funded by a top LA Venture Capital Firm (Mucker Capital). Kixie is a cloud-based phone and texting solution that helps sales teams connect with their leads - and support teams stay on top of their customers. We integrate richly and easily with any CRM, and leverage key moments of the customer journey to prompt sales reps to take action right away - and at exactly the right time. We boast the finest team of customer success reps in the SaaS industry, and make our home in sunny Santa Monica near the beach.

The Basics:

This position is in-office, not remote. We're looking for hardworking local candidates who can make the drive to Santa Monica, and want to be working at a buzzing, lively office every day.

The Technical Support Specialist role is a great opportunity to gain experience and grow professionally at a healthy, lively tech startup and hone valuable CS skills that will serve you well in your future. 1-2 years of past experience in a client-facing role is preferred.

Responsibilities:

Communicate with customers of all levels via phone, email, and chat
Be the first line contact for customer questions and issues, work with the appropriate internal teams (e.g. engineering, product management, customer success), to solve problems and manage them through to resolution
Work cross functionally within the company to communicate with all stakeholders in customers' success
Drive adoption and expansion of Kixie products by highlighting feature opportunities, educate customer on Kixie best practices, and create relevant strategies to customers and the Success team
Help design automated learning and development resources for new clients
Conduct regular screen-shares, workshops and customer training sessions to help our customers reach their business goals and advance their careers.
Create and maintain relationships with customers to better understand and achieve their needs


Requirements:

You are ridiculously patient
You are great at dealing with people and are comfortable via phone, email, and chat
You love solving new problems
You’re familiar with CRM tools like Pipedrive, Salesforce and Hubspot, or you’re a quick study who is eager to develop fluency with tools like these
You love learning new things and hate being bored at work
You’re data driven and willing to learn new tools like Looker to see if your efforts are making an impact.
You work with customers and create delightful interactions at all stages of the customer life-cycle.
You are familiar with technology and enjoy learning and building processes
Ideally - you are a graduate of a 4 year university


Benefits:

Salary range: 52k base - 66k OTE per year
Health, Dental and Vision benefits
401K
Unlimited PTO after 90 days
Legit Coffee (Nespresso)
Fun, hardworking atmosphere
Learn everything there is to know about tech startups and develop CS skills
Office blocks away from Santa Monica Beach
Reserved Parking Garage

The Opportunity




Pura, based in Pleasant Grove, UT, has been revolutionizing the fragrance and IOT (internet of things) connected experience in homes (and soon car) for the past several years. We obsess over providing world-class product experiences for our customers, partners, and vendors. We pride ourselves on maintaining a team-based culture of quality, innovation, and frequent growth and development!




We are currently hiring for an SEO Manager position to lead our SEO strategy and execution across our website experiences.




Who you are committed to being:




Outcomes focused with a passion for delivering value to the business
You are comfortable establishing and evangelizing a desired end state, or outcome, and motivating others to come along
You ask detailed and specific questions, understand nuance, and challenge conventional wisdom
Ability to deliver results in evolving framework with shifting priorities and technology
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop and manage relationships with cross functional team members
Strong analytical skills with an emphasis on Retail math
You thrive in a fast-paced environment that is experiencing incredible growth




What you’ll own:




Plan SEO projects, establish realistic timelines, communicate with stakeholders, manage vendor resources, and deliver measurable results
Partner with our creative teams to design, plan, create, and share valuable content for current and future Pura Owners
Optimize the technical implementation of the website to increase its organic search performance
Implement specialized techniques and methods that encourage backlinking to the Pura website
Use CRO tools to test new content for the purpose of increasing conversion rates and driving revenue
Partner with the Website team to optimize individual web pages to enhance their visibility in organic search results
Leverage website tools to publish SEO-optimized content and perform other content setup tasks




Experience you’ll need:




5-7 years of experience in SEO management for a consumer packaged goods company
Strong experience with creating a strategic roadmap to deliver our long term SEO goals
Experience facilitating cross-functional teams, including vendors, with a strong sense of accountability and how to drive a project forward
Demonstrated ability to speak on a technical level and communicate clearly with engineers, designers, copy writers, and data analysts
An analytical approach to understanding performance and testing new features for conversion rate optimization
Have a strong understanding of HTML and CSS to ensure SEO best practices for all web page development
Shopify experience preferred
IoT, Health & Wellness, or Fragrance experience preferred




Pura’s Story




Pura—a company that married smart-home technology and fragrance diffusers, all controlled by the Pura app. At Pura, our mission is to create a luxury fragrance experience in each home that can change moods and brighten days. We are partnering with the leading premium fragrance brands, celebrities and lifestyle brands in the industry to bring customers’ favorite scents to their home with the touch of a button. And that’s just the beginning.




Check out on our website, and explore the latest amazing fragrance launches on Instagram.




Pura started in 2014 and raised a seed round of 4.4M in February of 2020. Pura thrives on hiring or creating the best talent, known as a young and hungry brand that is rapidly becoming a household name around the world.




Join the Pura Team!

At StubHub, our mission is to bring the joy of live to fans globally. We’re the world's largest ticket marketplace, and we make sure that the events where you want to be are never sold out.

At StubHub, we are:

Owners – We carry the ball. We act as one team, in it together. We live above the line as optimists and with a solution mindset. We are fully accountable for solving problems, both our own pieces and the whole.

Fan First – We are the fans’ biggest fans. We are the fan and the voice of our fans in everything we do.

Driven – We push past the finish line, aggressively prioritize, and focus on what matters most. We debate, decide, commit and deliver.

Inventive – We play a new chord; we celebrate progress over perfection and learnings as much as success. We’re agile because there is always more than one way.

Courageous – We take big swings. We show up for challenges with resilience and persistence. We take risks, embrace failure as a path to learning, and speak up when we have different opinions.

Diverse & Inclusive – We harmonize. We assume positive intent, trust and empower others; bring a global mindset and seek out alternative viewpoints.

We would like to see:

3+ years of relevant analytics experience; understanding statistics, especially experimentation and causal inference
Experience with SQL
Knowledge of R or Python


We would prefer a teammate with:

Experience with A/B testing or experimental design
Ability to identify growth opportunities for our business and assist the success of our marketing
Success stories with people at all levels and across departments


You'd be able to:

Turn ambiguous questions into clear analytical problems, and solve them using data
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders on the key decisions that drive our user acquisition success
Build dashboards that give stakeholders visibility into the current state of our business
Use data to identify opportunities to improve marketing channel ROI
Establish KPIs that measure the performance of our operations and drive resource allocation


About the opportunity:

The Marketing Department at StubHub is responsible for all channels that connect users to their next live event experience. As a member of our Analytics team, you’ll be at the forefront of the experimentation and innovation that drives the growth of the business.

For over 20 years, StubHub has been the leading marketplace for fans to buy and sell tickets. Today, we continue to offer you peace of mind with our exclusive FanProtect Guarantee, best-in-class customer service, and product features that ensure we have your back. Combined with viagogo, we now span over 170 countries around the world, servicing buyers and sellers in 38 currencies and 40 different languages with our StubHub brand in North America and our viagogo brand outside of North America.

Are you interested in joining an ambitious and close-knit team dedicated to solving meaningful customer problems? Your work will have a significant impact on the business, and help spread the joy of concerts, theater, and sports around the world.

We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel StubHub is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, and included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

The anticipated gross salary range for this role is $128,500-$208,049 per year. Actual compensation will vary depending on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, experience, and competencies. Base annual salary is one component of StubHub’s total compensation and competitive benefits package, which includes equity, 401(k), paid time off, paid parental leave, and comprehensive health benefits.

Role: Data Engineer IV- Rate -$88Location : Greeley , CO Job DescriptionSummary: The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.Responsibilities for Data Engineer Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture, Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. About The Position




Development Director/Senior Director, MISO




The Director or Senior Director of development for MISO will be responsible for leading all technology (solar, wind, storage) development and strategy within MISO. The successful candidate will have deep of the MISO market; proven renewable project development and transaction experience in MISO; policy and market development experience; strong communication skills and financial acumen; and an ability to drive complex initiatives/deals to closure.




The Director will lead a team of development associates and analysts to build out a cross-technology greenfield portfolio, while assisting in evaluating and sourcing M&A opportunities. This individual will be responsible for tenaciously driving market development and value creation across diverse project pipelines. While the Senior Director/Director will work closely with the management team, they are expected to be hands-on and have a detailed grasp of both the details and the big picture.‍




Responsibilities & Essential Functions




Drive market and project development and value creation in MISO, taking responsibility for project success
Innovate on existing business models to deliver above-and-beyond results
Hire, train and manage a small team to enable regional sucess
Develop, own and execute the project development strategy and tactics of DG markets.
Work closely across multiple functions, including finance, revenue optimization, transmission and procurement to vet and understand project assumptions and push to find value across various value levers
Manage a team of market leads, business development leads, developers, and support staff while providing leadership and mentorship in negotiation, analysis, and risk assessment.
Direct market-wide activities with a focus on budget management and project profitability.
Originate, lead and/or manage due diligence on projects, sites, and counterparties for acquisition projects.
Analyze and interpret regulations, program economics, input prices and other data by market and provide input to the company’s business plan and development strategy
Develop and maintain partnerships across policy groups, customer acquisition and management providers, peer community developers and investors.




Qualifications




Four-year Bachelor’s degree, preference for a focus on energy, environmental, business or engineering industries. Master’s degrees a plus.
6-10+ years’ experience required in renewable energy development, with direct experience with at least 2 technology types.
Fully adept across MS Office Suite (specifically Excel and PowerPoint), Microsoft Teams
Strong working knowledge of GIS platforms and ability to manipulate GIS data as plus.
Experience directly managing project stakeholders, communities and policy makers to create the best project and market outcomes.
Ability to synthesize complex risks and opportunities into succinct and actionable directions.
Deep understanding of the policy, regulatory and competitive dynamics that drive revenue and market access in DG/Community markets.
Self-motivated with a high level of initiative, attention to detail and accountability.
Ability to multi-task and work in a deadline driven environment.
Strong interest in joining a dynamic, value-building environment and being part of a high-performing and collaborative team.
Direct leadership experience managing and hiring a small team.




‍




Compensation and Location




Job Type: Permanent, Full-time
Salary: A base salary commensurate with experience.
Bonus: An annual bonus will be awarded based on both individual performance as well as the overall success of the business.
Benefits: Benefit package with health care / dental / vision, and other health and wellness benefits.
Location: Chicago or San Fransico preferred




‍

CCS Analytics Summer Associate – Data Science (remote)

Location: Remote

Department: CCS Analytics

Reports To: Senior Vice President, Data Analytics

Duration: 10 Weeks (June – August)

Min. Experience: Earning a graduate degree

About CCS Fundraising

CCS Fundraising is an international strategic fundraising firm that partners with nonprofits for transformational change. For 76 years, CCS has empowered many of the world’s greatest organizations across sectors to advance some of the most important causes in history. We plan, manage, and implement programs and initiatives that achieve fundraising goals and mission impact.

CCS provides tailored support to more than 700 nonprofit organizations annually. Headquartered in New York, the firm has over 500 professionals and 18 offices throughout the United States and Europe. Our people are our greatest strength. At CCS, you will join a diverse team of smart, passionate, and resourceful professionals who are driven by purpose and committed to performance.

Understanding the Role

The CCS Analytics Summer Associate program is designed to offer a hands-on learning experience for individuals interested in leveraging data to help nonprofit organizations develop smarter and more impactful fundraising strategies.

The Associate Will Support The Team Across Two Areas

The Associate will work with CCS Fundraising’s Analytics team on a portfolio of external and internal initiatives that will produce client-facing deliverables and help define the team’s long-term planning.

Design and develop solutions for data analysis and reporting using R and R Markdown
Design and develop solutions for predictive modeling using R

Qualifications

The CCS Analytics Summer Associate – Data Science will be a graduate or doctoral student interested in the intersection of nonprofit strategy, fundraising and data science.

Other Qualifications Include

A passion for the nonprofit sector and a keen interest in how data can drive fundraising strategy
Knowledge of programming languages, especially R
Proficiency with statistics, modeling, machine learning, data visualization, and exploratory data analysis
Excellent project management skills with the ability to map out and meet goals and deadlines
Ability to work independently, with an assigned mentor, and with other members of a very strong team covering challenging and interesting assignments
Well-developed communication skills, both verbal and written, are required

CCS offers competitive benefits, a dynamic training program, resources, career advancement, mentoring, and networking opportunities. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage a diverse pool of candidates to apply.

Job Description Summary

This position is a key member of the IT Leadership Team that provides strategic development, technical design, and transformational delivery of Tecomet's Data analytics agenda as it relates to data design, technical infrastructure, risk management, and service management. This includes both short and long-term strategies in support of Tecomet's strategic growth, technical business enablement and IT organizational capability upgrade agendas

The ideal candidate will have proven abilities to transform a data culture, to partner with numerous functional areas to drive change, and to guide technical resources working with a diverse tech stack.

This person will be required to frame and answer operational and strategic questions from senior management and executive leadership, along with developing recommendations to drive efficiencies. The ideal candidate possesses advanced analytical abilities and will be able to work collaboratively & independently.

Primary Responsibilities

Conduct analytical work which directly impacts profitability, growth, and/or customer satisfaction outcomes

Evaluate and analyze results relative to expectation; understand, explain and communicate variances, and adapt solutions to reflect emerging insights

Create recommendations and drive implementation through effective partnership with stakeholders

Partner with colleagues to identify, design, quantify, and implement process/tech improvements

Manage aspects of moderate to complex projects and ad hoc requests to support sales/operational goals

Develop, update, and monitor reports or queries that provide insights on key performance indicators while supporting peers in completing their analyses; help migrate regularly scheduled reports to the reporting teams

Transition Tecomet’s existing analytical platform into new technical structure.

Soft Skills

Ability to work concurrently on a variety of opposing priorities, while remaining flexible to a constantly evolving regulatory environment.

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Experience in translating business requirements to technical resources in support of helping develop business solutions that reduce risk, increase business efficiency, and minimize impact.

Knowledge of and experience with tools and techniques for crafting, handling and evaluating business acceptance tests for end-to-end operational processes and end-users of solutions.

Experience with activities, tasks, and practices for assessing and detailing business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential solutions.

Knowledge of and shown ability to implement the strategies and techniques used to ensure that customer needs are addressed in solution design that result in a positive experience with the organization.

Technical Skills

5+ years of relational database experience

5+ years of analytical experience

Programming expertise with reporting tools (Tableau,Qlikview, other)

Proficiency in SQL, R, or Python programming languages

Experience developing ETL processes in Microsoft SSIS

Experience with MySQL with focus on database tuning

Experience developing SQL queries and stored procedures in Microsoft SQL Server

Ability to apply statistical rigor to analyses

Experience with "big data" environments

Interest in data storytelling

Description




Welcome to Searchspring, we’re happy you’re applying! We think the most important thing about Searchspring, about working anywhere, in fact, is the people and how they interact.




At Searchspring we foster an environment of caring, helpful, considerate, and empathic people. We think that’s the best environment to foster excellence and it is one of the things we care most about in our hiring process. If you are empathic and able to talk with humility and encourage others to thrive, we want to hear from you!




We don’t want brilliance without empathy. We don’t want creators who don’t share. We don’t want rock stars that don’t contribute to the community.




The Role




As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for the management and oversight of Searchspring customer implementation projects from project submission to project completion.




If you have a passion for relationships, problem-solving, and proactive collaboration, this is a great opportunity for you! Successful candidates will be extremely self-motivated, driven, committed, and dedicated to their team and clients. You enjoy building relationships and earning the trust of customers and co-workers and you excel at learning all aspects of a project, assessing needs, and finding solutions.




You’d be perfect for us if you’re organized, detail-oriented, naturally curious, and a self-learner. You have excellent communication and customer service skills, you easily adapt to change and handle conflict resolution well, and while being tenacious in your follow-up.




What You’ll Be Responsible For




Prioritize and assess new project submissions from new and existing customers and maintain project documentation for internal organization and project success.
Coordinate directly with customers to drive project kickoff conversations and determine project requirements, setting clear expectations and timelines with all stakeholders and the internal teams
Manage project phases, timelines, and update documents and other applicable tools in a timely manner
Organize and delegate tasks with project and solutions engineers
Facilitate project transition to the implementations team with clear notes and direction
Gather feedback and look for opportunities to improve processes for both customers and internal teams
Collaborate with the sales and onboarding teams to ensure smooth project expectations and a best-in-class onboarding experience for our customers
Help create enablement and process documentation for internal teams




What You’ll Bring To Searchspring




Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
Ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with clients, partners, etc. at all levels of organizations
2+ years experience in Ecommerce or website project management is preferred (Although nice to have, project management experience is not required for this role).
Previous experience with different eCommerce shopping cart platforms is preferred.
Have, or are willing to learn basic technical skills in Data Feeds, Google Analytics, HTML, Javascript, CSS, and APIs.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to work within a team environment.
Proficient computer skills (Google Office Suite, Click Up, etc.)
Strong ability to stay on task and meet multiple deadlines and deliverables simultaneously
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Comfortable learning new technology




Benefits




Start Fresh - take 2 weeks paid vacation immediately
Open PTO policy
Matching 401(k) plan
4 week Sabbatical after 5 years
9 paid public holidays each year
Company-paid health, dental, and vision insurance
Medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts
$1,000 annual education budget
$500 company donation matching
Start-up environment with a proven playbook
You will be part of a small, powerful team
Company Short Term Disability coverage
Company-paid Life and AD&D coverage with option to purchase additional coverage




Salary Range




Base salary ranges from $60k - $80k.




About Searchspring




Voted San Antonio Best Places to Work three years in a row and an Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing company two years in a row.




Searchspring is on a mission to give eCommerce teams superpowers. We are giving the worlds’ best merchandisers the user-friendly search, merchandising, personalization, and analytics tools they need to increase conversion and curate unique shopping experiences. Learn more at searchspring.com or visit the websites of some of our most heroic customers like PuraVida, Fabletics, Volcom, Williams Sonoma, or Alternative Apparel. If you love retail, eCommerce and have a passion for developing solutions to complex problems, come join us.




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and the background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and our customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world shops online.




We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Should you need accommodations during the application please don't hesitate to contact us.

The Project Coordinator at our Annandale, NJ office will report directly to Green Power Energy’s Director of Operations. The Project Coordinator will be responsible for applying for and obtaining approvals for solar and solar + storage projects. The solar industry is poised for significant growth and the right candidate will be joining the Operations Team in an exciting work environment.

Responsibilities:

Be a part of the team that is carrying out the company’s vision, culture and growth plan
Provide support for the Director of Operations in NJ
Complete Permit Applications, Interconnection Applications, and State Paperwork for Solar and Solar + Storage Projects
Receive deliveries and mail as well as make outbound mailings as required
Place, receive, and screen calls and receive outside guests in a professional manner
Provide support to the entire Operations Team and Associate requests as needed
Provide data entry support and maintain company’s CRM as needed
Actively track and prioritize project tasks needed to be completed on a weekly and daily basis by following up with townships, utility companies and customers as needed
Utility applications are filled out online and permit applications are filled out by hand
Send docusigns to the customers for signatures
Respond to customer and team emails on a daily basis
All other duties as assigned


Requirements

Excellent organizational skills
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

Job Summary




The incumbent in this position will be responsible for assisting the Academic Research Services Team (ARS) team with supporting the UCSF Research Compliance groups by creating, communicating, and implementing their vision and requirements with new reports system functionality and special projects. They will help establish objectives and work plans and assist with performing the tasks necessary to accomplish the tasks that align with the agreed-upon outcomes.




This position will be heavily involved in system analysis, configuration, testing, and support as well as developing system documentation that aids users with the use and management of the system.




This position works with different levels of stakeholders in the research areas including the other departmental IT resources that support different areas of research. Across research areas works with those stakeholders to support and understand how to effectively drive system and report changes needed to meet business processes and requirements, and based on those requirements provides recommended technical solutions and tools. These solutions will be supported by a central IT and the incumbent will be working with and a part of that team to either enhance or expand current offerings to support business and security requirements or provide recommendations for successful support.




The Research System Analyst will work closely with the Research Systems Business Analysis, Research Solutions Architect, and Research Program Manager as well as various members of the ARS team to oversee the set-up and management of the research services and support. In addition, they will need to work with the various teams in UCSF’s central IT and learn how they can be used to meet the requirements of the research community. Areas include UCSF’s Security, Compliance, Research Data, Research Administrative Applications, and Research Infrastructure (on-prem and cloud). They will need to analyze complex issues and work within defined procedures and practices, recommending the appropriate action.

Department Description




This position will be housed within the Central IT, which provides architecture, infrastructure, network, security, analytics, integration, and application support services and is essential to the organization’s ability to support growth, mitigate security risk, and manage, store and share sensitive information. Specifically, this position will report to the Academic Research Services Team (ARS), which is focused on providing central services for researchers.




Required Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training.
Advanced skills associated with design, modification/system configuration, and implementation. Basic knowledge of secure software development lifecycle. Demonstrated ability to create software specifications.
Understanding of and experience troubleshooting client issues and documenting the actions that can be taken to improve or correct performance. Experience in incident response and digital forensics, including data collection, examination, and analysis.
Thorough knowledge of business and process analysis functions. Knowledge of the design, development, and application of technology and systems to meet business needs.
Familiarity with logical data design and data mapping.
Demonstrated testing and test planning skills.
Ability to write technical documentation in a clear and concise manner.
Interpersonal skills sufficient to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Ability to elicit and communicate technical and non-technical information in a clear and concise manner.
Works independently and as part of a team. Demonstrated problem-solving skills. Ability to learn effectively and meet deadlines.
Broad knowledge of various areas of IT.




Preferred Qualifications




Advanced knowledge of computer security tools, best practices, and policies including demonstrated experience securing server-based software. Demonstrated skill at administering moderately complex security controls and configurations to computer hardware, software, and networks.
Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of how system management actions affect other systems, system users, and dependent/related functions.
Familiarity with data quality and governance issues and requirements.




About UCSF




The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.




Pride Values




UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.




In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Location: San Diego, CA (La Jolla, CA)

Bachelor’s Degree in Informatics, Information Systems, Engineering or related field with 6+ years’ relevant experience

• Prior experience with R analytics, Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI or any combination. Preference for expertise in more than one platform

Job_description:
At StubHub, our mission is to bring the joy of live to fans globally. We’re the world's largest ticket marketplace, and we make sure that the events where you want to be are never sold out.

At StubHub, we are:

Owners – We carry the ball. We act as one team, in it together. We live above the line as optimists and with a solution mindset. We are fully accountable for solving problems, both our own pieces and the whole.

Fan First – We are the fans’ biggest fans. We are the fan and the voice of our fans in everything we do.

Driven – We push past the finish line, aggressively prioritize, and focus on what matters most. We debate, decide, commit and deliver.

Inventive – We play a new chord; we celebrate progress over perfection and learnings as much as success. We’re agile because there is always more than one way.

Courageous – We take big swings. We show up for challenges with resilience and persistence. We take risks, embrace failure as a path to learning, and speak up when we have different opinions.

Diverse & Inclusive – We harmonize. We assume positive intent, trust and empower others; bring a global mindset and seek out alternative viewpoints.

We would like to see:

3+ years of relevant analytics experience; understanding statistics, especially experimentation and causal inference
Experience with SQL
Knowledge of R or Python


We would prefer a teammate with:

Experience with A/B testing or experimental design
Ability to identify growth opportunities for our business and assist the success of our marketing
Success stories with people at all levels and across departments


You'd be able to:

Turn ambiguous questions into clear analytical problems, and solve them using data
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders on the key decisions that drive our user acquisition success
Build dashboards that give stakeholders visibility into the current state of our business
Use data to identify opportunities to improve marketing channel ROI
Establish KPIs that measure the performance of our operations and drive resource allocation


About the opportunity:

The Marketing Department at StubHub is responsible for all channels that connect users to their next live event experience. As a member of our Analytics team, you’ll be at the forefront of the experimentation and innovation that drives the growth of the business.

For over 20 years, StubHub has been the leading marketplace for fans to buy and sell tickets. Today, we continue to offer you peace of mind with our exclusive FanProtect Guarantee, best-in-class customer service, and product features that ensure we have your back. Combined with viagogo, we now span over 170 countries around the world, servicing buyers and sellers in 38 currencies and 40 different languages with our StubHub brand in North America and our viagogo brand outside of North America.

Are you interested in joining an ambitious and close-knit team dedicated to solving meaningful customer problems? Your work will have a significant impact on the business, and help spread the joy of concerts, theater, and sports around the world.

We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel StubHub is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, and included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.

The anticipated gross salary range for this role is $128,500-$208,049 per year. Actual compensation will vary depending on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, experience, and competencies. Base annual salary is one component of StubHub’s total compensation and competitive benefits package, which includes equity, 401(k), paid time off, paid parental leave, and comprehensive health benefits.

Description:* Data Analytics Internal Audit / Compliance Associate The Associate Internal Audit/Compliance Data Analyst will be part of the Internal Audit team and work closely with the Compliance team to empower, design, and deliver analytics that increase the assurance of audits and regulatory controls, while also providing insight into the operating effectiveness of the control environment. In this role you will:
Work alongside the Data Analytics Manager to design, execute and develop queries and/or reports used to support internal and external testing of business functions performed within the organization.
Engage in product lifecycle walk-throughs for a majority of areas within the business to identify data from primary and secondary data sources that can be analyzed for trends and patterns.
Present findings (oral or written) in the form of graphs, tables, charts and/or write-ups.
Review existing code and/or report output to analyze effectiveness.
Build and maintain skills related to technical issues such as data extraction, data file formats and structures, transporting data, merging files, and data manipulation and management (keys, indexing, normalization, etc.).
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Assist in the maintenance and development of the existing software used for internal tracking of risk. You’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with audit and compliance teams along with business clients, identifying challenges by asking probing questions, and providing unprecedented insights through the effective analysis and interpretation of data.

Programming experience using database languages (SQL, SAS, Python, SNOWFLAKE, etc.) required

Ability to work with spreadsheets (Excel) and combine data from multiple sources
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent work experience
Strong analytical and logical thinking skills are required to interpret data and draw conclusions
Industry experience in finance, banking, or a related field desired
Regulatory and Compliance knowledge a plus

Job Summary




The incumbent in this position will be responsible for assisting the Academic Research Services Team (ARS) team with supporting the UCSF Research Compliance groups by creating, communicating, and implementing their vision and requirements with new reports system functionality and special projects. They will help establish objectives and work plans and assist with performing the tasks necessary to accomplish the tasks that align with the agreed-upon outcomes.




This position will be heavily involved in system analysis, configuration, testing, and support as well as developing system documentation that aids users with the use and management of the system.




This position works with different levels of stakeholders in the research areas including the other departmental IT resources that support different areas of research. Across research areas works with those stakeholders to support and understand how to effectively drive system and report changes needed to meet business processes and requirements, and based on those requirements provides recommended technical solutions and tools. These solutions will be supported by a central IT and the incumbent will be working with and a part of that team to either enhance or expand current offerings to support business and security requirements or provide recommendations for successful support.




The Research System Analyst will work closely with the Research Systems Business Analysis, Research Solutions Architect, and Research Program Manager as well as various members of the ARS team to oversee the set-up and management of the research services and support. In addition, they will need to work with the various teams in UCSF’s central IT and learn how they can be used to meet the requirements of the research community. Areas include UCSF’s Security, Compliance, Research Data, Research Administrative Applications, and Research Infrastructure (on-prem and cloud). They will need to analyze complex issues and work within defined procedures and practices, recommending the appropriate action.

This position will be housed within the Central IT, which provides architecture, infrastructure, network, security, analytics, integration, and application support services and is essential to the organization’s ability to support growth, mitigate security risk, and manage, store and share sensitive information. Description




Welcome to Searchspring, we’re happy you’re applying! We think the most important thing about Searchspring, about working anywhere, in fact, is the people and how they interact.




At Searchspring we foster an environment of caring, helpful, considerate, and empathic people. We think that’s the best environment to foster excellence and it is one of the things we care most about in our hiring process. If you are empathic and able to talk with humility and encourage others to thrive, we want to hear from you!




We don’t want brilliance without empathy. We don’t want creators who don’t share. We don’t want rock stars that don’t contribute to the community.




The Role




As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for the management and oversight of Searchspring customer implementation projects from project submission to project completion.




If you have a passion for relationships, problem-solving, and proactive collaboration, this is a great opportunity for you! Successful candidates will be extremely self-motivated, driven, committed, and dedicated to their team and clients. You enjoy building relationships and earning the trust of customers and co-workers and you excel at learning all aspects of a project, assessing needs, and finding solutions.




You’d be perfect for us if you’re organized, detail-oriented, naturally curious, and a self-learner. You have excellent communication and customer service skills, you easily adapt to change and handle conflict resolution well, and while being tenacious in your follow-up.




What You’ll Be Responsible For




Prioritize and assess new project submissions from new and existing customers and maintain project documentation for internal organization and project success.
Coordinate directly with customers to drive project kickoff conversations and determine project requirements, setting clear expectations and timelines with all stakeholders and the internal teams
Manage project phases, timelines, and update documents and other applicable tools in a timely manner
Organize and delegate tasks with project and solutions engineers
Facilitate project transition to the implementations team with clear notes and direction
Gather feedback and look for opportunities to improve processes for both customers and internal teams
Collaborate with the sales and onboarding teams to ensure smooth project expectations and a best-in-class onboarding experience for our customers
Help create enablement and process documentation for internal teams




What You’ll Bring To Searchspring




Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
Ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with clients, partners, etc. at all levels of organizations
2+ years experience in Ecommerce or website project management is preferred (Although nice to have, project management experience is not required for this role).
Previous experience with different eCommerce shopping cart platforms is preferred.
Have, or are willing to learn basic technical skills in Data Feeds, Google Analytics, HTML, Javascript, CSS, and APIs.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to work within a team environment.
Proficient computer skills (Google Office Suite, Click Up, etc.)
Strong ability to stay on task and meet multiple deadlines and deliverables simultaneously
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Comfortable learning new technology




Benefits




Start Fresh - take 2 weeks paid vacation immediately
Open PTO policy
Matching 401(k) plan
4 week Sabbatical after 5 years
9 paid public holidays each year
Company-paid health, dental, and vision insurance
Medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts
$1,000 annual education budget
$500 company donation matching
Start-up environment with a proven playbook
You will be part of a small, powerful team
Company Short Term Disability coverage
Company-paid Life and AD&D coverage with option to purchase additional coverage




Salary Range




Base salary ranges from $60k - $80k.




About Searchspring




Voted San Antonio Best Places to Work three years in a row and an Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing company two years in a row.




Searchspring is on a mission to give eCommerce teams superpowers. We are giving the worlds’ best merchandisers the user-friendly search, merchandising, personalization, and analytics tools they need to increase conversion and curate unique shopping experiences. Learn more at searchspring.com or visit the websites of some of our most heroic customers like PuraVida, Fabletics, Volcom, Williams Sonoma, or Alternative Apparel. If you love retail, eCommerce and have a passion for developing solutions to complex problems, come join us.




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and the background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and our customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of changing the way the world shops online.




We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Should you need accommodations during the application please don't hesitate to contact us.

Job SummaryThe Data Analyst will work with a team to provide high-quality service to our customer in managing the logistics IT portfolio of systems. This role is responsible for the execution of data management activities within the areas of data quality and data asset management.This position is a collaborative role providing support for analysis and research into our data structures, attribution, maintenance, and models to ensure they are compliant with the organization’s strategic data management direction. This position is also responsible for maintaining the visibility and integrity of the portfolio’s data asset inventory by identifying and closing information gaps that may exist.The Data Analyst will work within an agile team to provide high-quality service to our customer by applying analysis techniques to determine solutions based on client requirements with an IT services/solutions-based scope. They will analyze and reverse engineer business and technical artifacts such as data models, data catalogs, design documentation and interfaces to capture, store and maintain relevant metadata for the systems within the portfolio. This role may also be expected to develop and maintain data quality assessments and data profiles for the systems within the LogIT portfolio. As such, they will be expected to work closely with functional and technical data stewards to present their findings and provide recommendations for addressing issues which may be identified.Job Duties And Responsibilities Analyzes operational activities to obtain a quantitative, rational basis for decision making and resource allocation  Conceptually understand and convey to stakeholders and leadership complex topics related to data management, data governance, and data maturity.  Working with subject matter experts (SME) across organizations to collect and update business and technical metadata.  Reverse engineer data models and other design or build artifacts to extract relevant business and technical metadata and load into a metadata repository  Creates project plans to achieve performance-based objectives, enhancing implementation, systems and service  Review submitted data to detect data quality problems and anomalies and help organization correct data: both current and historical  Provides integral support in mission requirements determination, conceptualization, design, development, testing, verification and validation, documentation, and implementation of system applications  Collects and analyzes data and associated system artifacts for stakeholders to use in perfecting their business practices  Performs analysis to determine how data might best be applied to profit the stakeholders  Other duties as assigned. Job Requirements (Education/Skills/Experience)You'll need to have: Ability to obtain an active DoD Secret Clearance  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar and 5+ years of experience  Experience with ETL or data movement software such as Informatica, Talend, SSIS, NiFi, StreamSets, DataBricks, Jupyter Notebooks etc…  Experience using SQL for data analysis, data quality, and data profiling activities.  Experience in one or more scripting languages  Experience in ETL performance optimization  Experience working with large data sets in enterprise-level data warehousing/lake environments  Experience creating data mapping documentation for databases, interfaces and applications  Experience with Agile development methodologies and roles Even Better If You Have Experience with AF Logistics systems and data  Experience leading a team of developers and analysts designing complex data warehouse/lake solutions  Experience in requirements elicitation  Experience in Information Management including data design, data transformation, data governance or other major DAMA DMBOK or industry recognized data management practice  Extensive practical experience of working with and defining data  Excellent written and verbal communications  Logical thinker; able to articulate thoughts both verbally and diagrammatically  Prior experience of logical data modelling and data normalization  Experience interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques  Experience with data collection systems and their strategies #ddcitservicesjobsThis contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60–1.4(a), 60–300.5(a) and 60–741.5(a). As a Analytics and Data consultant you will use business and technical acumen to be responsible for coordinating and managing the development of analytical data solutions and processes in order to drive business decisions and solutions for the business vertical to which they are aligned. You will work alongside data, analytics, business, and technology stakeholders as integrators and translators to effectively, efficiently, and consistently implement work across the company.




What you will be doing:




Work with business partners to understand their data needs that will contribute to their strategic direction and understand how potential actions will influence their business results.
Drive activities to develop data product strategies and identify high priority initiatives to deliver and execute on the operating plan.
Provide direction as to where data and analytics could be leveraged in order to make key business decisions.
Contribute to high complexity projects/products and drives moderately complex medium impact projects/products from ideation to delivery in an Agile framework, with an emphasis on measurable, value add deliverables.
Drive and maintain partnerships through the development process to in order to ensure the successful transition of moderately complex research to an operational state within the business unit.
Support the Data Delivery Lead with high-level model design by providing business requirements, and providing an understanding of data domains and their impact to the business.
Drive the creation of data visualization tools to actively monitor and identify potential of our pattern elements in our business results.




Who You Are




We are looking for someone with:




Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience; 3+ years of related analytics, consulting, project management, or equivalent experience preferred.
Experience working with PowerBI is required.
Marketing skills/experience (preferred).
Beginner/Intermediate SQL, R, Python, Tableau or other analytical tools.
Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of business operations, values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions, and ability to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis and the ability to determine the root cause of organizational problems and create alternative solutions that resolve the problems in the best interest of the business.
Business Acumen, knowledge, insight, and understanding of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.




Salary Range Information




Salary ranges below reflect targeted base salaries. Non-sales positions have the opportunity to participate in a bonus program. Sales positions are eligible for sales incentives, and in some instances a bonus plan, whereby total compensation may far exceed base salary depending on individual performance. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer.




Salary Range




$77350 - $147600 / year




Additional Information




Job level




We’ll consider talent at the next level with the right experiences and skills.




Work Authorization/Sponsorship




At this time, we're not considering candidates that need any type of immigration sponsorship now or in the future or those needing work authorization for this role. (This includes, but is not limited to students on F1-OPT, F1-CPT, J-1, etc.)

For Principal Global Investors positions, you’ll need to follow an Investment Code of Ethics related to personal and business conduct as well as personal trading activities for you and members of your household. These same requirements may also apply to other positions across the organization.

Tech Dynamism (TD) is a technology consulting firm that helps organizations improve their business performance and achieve long-term goals by using technology in innovative ways.




Position Overview:




We’re looking for a Senior Business Analyst to guide our clients through the implementation of a system platform and transition to the new business operation. You will be working directly with clients and our internal teams to translate discussions into clear requirements that create the best solution design and necessary process changes/improvements. As the primary client advocate and proxy Product Owner, the Sr Business Analyst will drive design decisions and is ultimately responsible for ensuring our final solution meets the client’s needs.




The successful candidate has solutions-oriented experience as a business analyst that can facilitate consensus amongst diverse stakeholder opinions.




This position can be done 100% remotely or in-person at our Charlottesville office.




Essential Functions:




Direct interviews of business stakeholders (extract “why” and “how”) - including end users, operational management and system owners
Clarify and gain consensus on the business purpose for the rest of the project team, including software engineers, quality assurance analysts, and user experience designers
Analyze current state processes and propose improvements
Research technical solution options and present recommendations
Effectively and efficiently guide and drive design discussions to consensus and approval
Develop Agile Scrum BA documentation (process flows, user stories, acceptance criteria)
Work on multiple projects at the same time
Map end-to-end processes that cross multiple departments in a large organization, identifying task ownership, decision points, hand-offs, and opportunities for improvement
Facilitate conversations with stakeholders at various levels (directors to operational staff) and guide to a consensus
Work with client to identify root cause of issues and create plans to resolve (e.g., can a policy change instead of creating overly-complex technical solutions or manual work)
Support client with vendor management by providing technical and project execution expertise




Qualifications:




3+ years of Business analysis experience
Contribute and coach in Agile Scrum methodology
Familiarity with business analysis / Scrum tools: Process Mapping, Solution Design, Data Analysis, Requirements/Epics, User Stories, Test Cases/Scenarios
Comfortable learning and operating organizational systems (i.e. becoming a “power user” for enterprise software)
Ability to discern the appropriate process model needed to effectively drive the project
Exposure to multiple systems across multiple domains
Familiarity communicating with multiple layers of stakeholders (from C-Level to front line operators)
Strong attention to detail and adherence to specific templates, processes and guidelines, while also contributing to ongoing process improvement
Ability to operate both independently and effectively in a high pressure, deadline-based environment
Able to navigate and manage ambiguity
Able to quickly learn new business areas and their needs




Benefits:




Consistent 40-hour work week
Flexible working schedule
Remote option or in Charlottesville office




Who We Are:




Tech Dynamism is a technology consulting company that helps businesses align the forces of their technology with their mission and operations. There is nothing more important to a consulting company than its people. We are a rapidly growing firm of passionate and compassionate individuals. We are always looking for ways to improve the work experience of our clients and their customers. We do that by collaborating with our clients to diagnose problems and develop workable solutions.




Tech Dynamism is a values-driven company. Our bottom line is critically important, but our vision extends beyond it: we are deeply committed to serving our community so all can thrive. Our goal is not to be the biggest, but the best at what we do.




People: Those who work for us and those we serve, are the heart of our business. We will only grow as quickly as we can find the best people.




Passion: Loving what we do drives the extraordinary service we give our clients. We exceed their expectations, building long-term relationships.




Integrity: We keep our commitments, strive for flawless execution, and stand by our clients until the project is completed to their satisfaction.

Brightways is looking for an HR Generalist to add to our existing HR Team of one. This is a salaried ($55k-$65k annually), full-time work-from-home position with the request to be available to come onsite to our central Oregon offices as needed. This role does require you to live in Oregon. Below is a list of job duties and company benefits to explore and see if this position sounds right for you!




Essential job duties:




Support various HR functions through the course of the employee lifecycle. Maintain knowledge of HR trends, laws, and best practices to implement and improve companywide.




Recruitment- utilize ATS and other technology to fulfill recruitment efforts such as: maintain job postings, source applicants, coordinate interviews/interview itineraries, candidate communication, maintain social media/job boards, send offer letters, conducting background checks, calling candidate referrals




On-boarding- sending new hire paperwork, data entry for new hire/benefits/payroll, aiding in orientation and training efforts (scheduling, itineraries, supervisor support), new hire setup and communication processes




Payroll- cross-train on payroll responsibilities, ensure timekeeping communication and processes are followed, ensure accuracy with pay/PTO accruals




Benefits- support enrollment (annual and new hires), maintain information of all benefits and processes, ensure accuracies in deductions, explore other benefits solutions to enhance offerings




Compliance- ensure compliance efforts for federal and state requirements, support accommodation, leave of absence, safety (Safety Committee), processes, and policies




Qualifications:




Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, management, HR, or similar industry; or equivalent applicable knowledge and experience in lieu of education
Certification: HR certification(s) preferred; willingness to gain knowledge in specific areas of HR to advance applicable knowledge
Experience: At least three (3) years of HR experience required; focused recruiting, payroll, or benefits experience highly preferred. Knowledge and use of various HRIS and ATS required.
Tools: Must have reliable transportation for onsite meetings when needed and the ability to work remote in a secure, HIPAA compliant home office with minimal disruption




Competencies (knowledge, skills, abilities):




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations
Knowledge of and experience with varied HRIS solutions
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, SharePoint, and other related software
Efficiency and time management skills
Maintain confidentiality
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and writing skills
Ability to deal professionally, courteously, and efficiently, and to remain calm under stress




Physical Requirements:




Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times




Summary of Benefits:




Compensation- $55,000-$65,000 annually




Time-Off- two (2) weeks PTO, pro-rated based on start date




Health Insurance Coverage- cost-shared health, vision, and dental insurance for employees and dependents; acupuncture, chiropractic, and orthodontia




Flexible Spending Account (FSA)- your pre-tax dollars towards unreimbursed medical and/or dependent care expenses




Supplemental Benefits- Term Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Accident, and Choice (Hospital) benefits offered at a discount




Retirement/401K- non-elective employer contribution benefit after one (1) year of employment; employees may defer funds into pre-tax or Roth options on the first of the month following employment; discretionary profit-sharing bonus annually




Employee Assistant Program- (EAP), 24/7 access to a confidential EAP Specialist for access to counseling referrals and legal consultations; budgeting, home buying, will preparation and estate planning, and more.




Financial Wellness Program- includes financial assessments and dashboards, budget calculators, student loan debt concierge, short-term loans, and more.




Discounts- savings on hotels, theme parks, concerts and sporting events, movie tickets, retail, restaurants, spas, activities, rental cars, gift cards, and more to make the most of your time away from work.

Headquartered in Bend, Oregon, one of the country’s most beautiful and desirable areas, Brightways has offices in Bend, Redmond, Madras, and Woodburn. We serve communities across the state via telehealth services and continue to grow.




Recently awarded the 2022 Small Business Person(s) of the Year for the state of Oregon by the Small Business Administration (SBA), Brightways is determined to continue their efforts in going above and beyond for the company, the community, and our clients.

Job_description:
Minimum Qualifications

Non-competitive: bachelor’s degree in data or computer science, informatics, economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related field, and either: satisfactory completion of a two-year traineeship or two years of experience* in data visualization, and statistical models and data mining tools

Substitution: A master’s degree in the above fields may substitute for one year of the specialized experience. A Ph.D. in the above fields may substitute for two years of the specialized experience.

Duties Description

Job_description:
GROWTH DIRECTOR – USA REMOTE




ABOUT US:




Alleyoop is an award-winning beauty brand that’s redefining multifunctional with easy and efficient products that do more than one thing - helping you save time, money, and space. We’re simplifying beauty so you can spend less time in front of the mirror, and more time doing whatever brings joy to your world. We’re also a clean, vegan, cruelty-free, and eco-friendly brand -- using on average 51.9% less raw materials vs traditional products in the beauty industry!




As a digital-first brand, we’re looking for a dynamic, creative, and experienced Growth leader responsible for leading, developing, and executing the company’s acquisition marketing strategy across all digital channels while at the same time leveraging their keen eye for innovative design to elevate the brand forward.




WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:




Lead the development, planning, and execution of a 360-degree marketing plan that encompasses digital customer acquisition campaigns across all social & non-social channels (paid search, display, native, remarketing, affiliates, referrals, and email)
Drive sustainable, controlled growth through a data-driven and systematic approach to acquisition and retention
Create and test new funnels, landing pages, offers, creatives, and audiences to maximize ROAS
Lead reporting and analytics across all channels and own the performance of all relevant KPI's (LTV, CAC, contribution margin, channel ROAS targets, retention cohorts, customer churn feedback, etc)
Develop an experimentation and testing framework for new channels
Lead and manage the development and growth of an in-house growth team, and any




freelancers, agencies, etc as needed
Contribute to CRO strategies in collaboration with designers and developers
Manage a budget and measure success with analytics to maximize ROI
Develop launch strategies with the Brand & Product Development team for new




products and product categories




WHO YOU ARE:




Be obsessed with all things growth. You keep up with the latest growth trends and blogs, and meet with other marketing leaders on your spare time because of your desire to succeed.
Want to drastically improve metrics and seek out new marketing channels, never relying too heavily on one channel for growth.
Have at least 3 years of prior experience as the lead marketing person on your team.
Have at least 5 years of experience in DTC growth marketing/customer acquisition.
Be a friendly, no-ego doer.
Be data-driven. We don't speak other languages.
Be able to work and think independently.




WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US:




We value culture over everything and look for managers who can inspire others and help cultivate their leadership skills.
We’re a high-energy, creative, contagiously enthusiastic & positive team that encourages and motivates each other to live the best version of our personal and professional selves every day.
Like our products, we’re ambitious, overachieving, and multi-tasking. And like our brand, we’re funny, supportive, and don’t take ourselves very seriously.
Competitive compensation and the opportunity to join a fun and growing team
Leadership team that offers a dynamic and energetic environment to grow and develop
Distributed team
Unlimited PTO policy
100% coverage of Blue Shield medical benefits
End-of-week gratitude sessions to celebrate all of our team’s weekly wins!




Alleyoop is dedicated to promoting diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and any other protected status as required by applicable law. We strive to be a place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work!

This is a remote, work-from-home position**

At Decideware, we live and breathe marketing procurement, operations, and agency management.

Founded in Australia in 1999, Decideware quickly expanded to the US and Europe to be closer to the world’s largest advertisers. Currently our services team is headquartered in the US, serving clients that operate globally.

The candidate should be a smart and deliberate decision maker, with a passion for helping clients maximize the value they realize from their technology tools. The candidate will create and maintain dashboards, working closely with the end client, using cutting edge technology, in close collaboration with Decideware’s development team. Mozart Therapeutics is a pre-clinical biopharmaceutical company located in Seattle, focused on developing novel immune engagers that specifically target a subset of T lymphocytes to delay the onset and ameliorate pathology of autoimmune diseases. We are developing first-in-class immune modulators that specifically target a novel regulatory T cell network. The company is seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join the Protein Engineering group. The ideal candidate will work in a dynamic start-up environment to perform basic molecular biology, protein purification and analytical assays as part of a small pre-clinical immunotherapy research team focused on the discovery, generation, and development of therapeutic candidates in inflammatory and autoimmune disease.




Responsibilities:




Perform cell culture harvest and protein recovery.
Execute affinity, size exclusion and ion-exchange chromatography.
Perform protein characterization and analytics (e.g. gel electrophoresis, SE-HPLC, ELISA and BLI kinetic analysis).
Service and maintain laboratory instruments as needed.
Summarize experimental results into interpretable data, presentations, reports, lab notebook records and present at group meetings.
Work in coordination with team members to design and execute experimental protocols.
Perform additional tasks as requested to support research projects and teams including the generation of graphs and experimental detail for presentations, manuscripts, patent applications and regulatory filings.




Qualifications:




Research Associate I candidates should have: BA in molecular biology, biochemistry, bioengineering or related field with 2+ years relevant experience in the biopharmaceutical industry or academic research environment. The salary range is $54,115 min to $82,885 max. Fully qualified candidates will be paid in proximity to the midpoint of the salary range.




Protein purification experience with expertise in AKTA and HPLC systems is highly desired.
Working knowledge of good laboratory practices and sterile technique is preferred.
Experience with the development of bi-specific and multi-functional proteins is preferred.
Proficiency using MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Powerpoint & Access).
Knowledge of lab-based programs (e.g. Chemstation and Unicorn software).
Experience with Empower or other HPLC software preferred.
Must have strong data collection, reduction, and summary skills.
An understanding of good project management and working towards deliverables and goals on a timeline is required.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Previous laboratory experience in drug development of biologics in a biotech industry setting, knowledge of protein engineering and research scale protein production and analytics is preferred.
We are looking for a strong team player with a passion for science and helping discover and develop novel therapies for unmet medical needs.




Mozart Therapeutics is an innovative, fast paced, collaborative culture looking to hire individuals who are seeking to make a significant contribution to advancing and developing novel CD8 Treg modulators that target a subset of T lymphocytes to improve clinical outcomes in patients with autoimmune diseases. We are a well-funded privately held biopharmaceutical company founded in 2020.




We offer our employees competitive compensation including annual performance bonuses and stock option grants. The pay wage range shown is based on the job posting’s primary location. Actual compensation packages are based on a wide array of factors, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and location, in addition to internal equity and alignment with market data. Benefits, including 15 days of paid vacation, 80 hours paid sick leave, 9 designated paid holiday and paid time off between Dec 25 and Jan 1, medical, dental and vision insurance, $250K life insurance, 401(k) with 100% company matching on first 3% and 50% match on next 2% and stock options. All benefits are non-contractual and may be amended, terminated or enhanced as Mozart Therapeutics deems necessary. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Description

WWC Global is seeking a Data Scientist supporting the Special Operations Command (SOCOM) vice commander-directed Data Stewardship Program lead by the SOCOM Command Data and Artificial Intelligence Office. The Data Scientist will have skills sets of both of a data analyst and data engineer. This candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining a data pipeline. In addition, the Data Scientist shall understand some of the most challenging processes, technologies, and can leverage a vast array of methodologies in the field, such as data mining, natural language programming, and machine learning. The Data Scientist must have a combination of skills that includes programming, mathematical modeling, statistics, and domain knowledge. They must combine an advanced math and statistics background with programming, domain knowledge, and communication skills to analyze data, create applied mathematical models, and present results in a form useful to the organization. They must also be able to understand and manipulate structured and unstructured large data sets, which requires proficiency in distributed SQL programming, relational and non-relational data queries, general programming languages (such as Python and R) and machine learning techniques.

Responsibilities Include

Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results and provide previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build Data environments providing data identified by other data professionals.
Apply and develop scientific methodology, statistics and algorithms to discover and frame relevant problems, hypotheses, and opportunities.
Develop predictive and prescriptive modeling, natural language processing (NLP), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), text mining and processing, clustering, forecasting methods, and other advanced statistical techniques.
Design and automate processes to facilitate the manipulation and analysis of data. Manage and integrate data across dissimilar data sets. Analyze large-scale structured and unstructured data.
Use frameworks such as Spark and Hadoop to conduct large-scale data processing. Perform statistical modeling and create data visualizations using products like Tableau, Microsoft Power BI and R Shiny.
Research, design, and implement algorithms to solve complex problems. Program using R, Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas) or similar analytical languages.
Perform data engineering, data processing and modeling techniques using cloud-based data management, data science, and ML platforms such as Databricks, IBM Cloud Pak, Cloudera, and Snowflake.
Communicate complex concepts and hypothesis to a non-technical audience through digital storytelling.


This position is contingent on contract award.

Work Environment

Moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phone and printers) and /or occasional Loud noise (airfield, large equipment).
Ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time.


Physical Demands

While performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to sit, stand, talk, and hear.
Employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers to operate a computer.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Travel

0-10% / Minimal travel expected.


WWC Global, a Pequot company, is a tribally-owned firm providing management consulting services to U.S. government agencies.
